-   Added the download all assignments functionality to Assignments

-   Ordered Gradebook columns alphabetically

## Isidore 2.0.1 - September 2008 {#isidore_2.0.1___september_2008}

## Isidore 2.0.0\* - August 2008 {#isidore_2.0.0___august_2008}

-   Implemented LDAP integration
-   Increased the maximum file upload size to 50 MB
-   Added Forums
-   Added Messages
-   Added Chat
-   Created help documentation for Modules
-   Adjusted default permissions for students and TAs

-   Added the ability for students to see Turnitin.com originality
    reports in the Assignments tool
-   Added functionality so that when a site is created after the start
    of a term, the site is automatically published

## Isidore 2.4.0\* - December 2009 {#isidore_2.4.0___december_2009}

-   Added the Blogs tool, which gives students and instructors blogging
    capability
-   Added Turnitin (plagiarism detection) integration to the Assignments
    tool
-   Added the Site Statistics tool, which allows instructors to view
    site visits, tool activity, and resource access
-   Added images to help documentation
-   Made tools that are turned off to students be italicized and in
    parentheses
-   Added fix that allows sorting by column headers in IE 7 to work
-   Added fix that made the exported Gradebook and the Gradebook show
    the same course grade
-   Updated FCKeditor to 2.6.4.1
-   Added fix that enables the calendar in the Schedule tool to pop-up
    in IE 6 and IE 7
-   Fixed a bug in the Assignments tool where \'allow resubmission\' was
    automatically checked after opening the attachments
-   Fixed a bug where users couldn\'t open attachments with weird
    characters in the filename
-   Not released (but saved) grades are now available when you download
    grades
-   Fixed a bug where students cannot remove files from a file upload
    question in Tests & Quizzes
-   Instructors can now set the resubmission option in the new/edit
    assignment view
-   Fixed a bug where \'inactive\' participants were still counted in
    the In/New count in the Assignments tool
-   Fixed a bug where grading in Assignments should not have a \'0\'
    option when allowing resubmissions
-   Fixed a bug where attachments for \'model answer\' or \'all purpose
    item\' were not visible in the Assignments tool
-   Fixed a bug where instructors could not view previously returned
    attachments in the Assignments tool
-   Increased question length in Tests & Quizzes

## Isidore 2.3.6 - November 2009 {#isidore_2.3.6___november_2009}

-   Changed the email subject for assignment submissions from \"Email
    Notification for Assignment Submission\" to \"Notification for an
    Assignment Submission: Course - Assignment\"

## Isidore 2.3.5 - October 2009 {#isidore_2.3.5___october_2009}

-   Increased file upload size to 100 MB
-   Added the ability for instructors to choose a gradebook category
    during the assessment creation process

## Isidore 2.3.4 - October 2009 {#isidore_2.3.4___october_2009}

-   Increased character limit in Tests & Quizzes tool
-   Added a checkbox in the Assignments tool to email students their
    grade during the grading process
-   Added a reminder to students to submit their assignments in the
    Assignments tool

## Isidore 2.3.3 - October 2009 {#isidore_2.3.3___october_2009}

-   Fixed a bug caused by \< \> symbols in the comment section of Tests
    & Quizzes
-   Added the ability to create a text column in the Gradebook
-   Added the ability to hide the student name column in the Gradebook

## Isidore 2.3.2 - September 2009 {#isidore_2.3.2___september_2009}

-   Fixed a bug where a forum without any topics made the main forums
    page disappear

## Isidore 2.3.1 - August 2009 {#isidore_2.3.1___august_2009}

-   Fixed a bug where PPT files in the forums tool didn\'t display the
    PPT icon

## Isidore 2.3.0\* - August 2009 {#isidore_2.3.0___august_2009}

-   Added \'select all\' check box when copying questions from a
    question pool
-   Added functionality for tests and quizzes to be released to specific
    groups
-   Improved the page load speed of the Forums tool
-   Upgraded to Sakai 2.6.x
-   Added a pop-up notification when adding the Resources tool reminding
    users that the Resources tool is turned off to students by default
-   Upgraded FCeditor to 2.6.4
-   Added the ability for students to replace their assignment
    submissions prior to the due date
-   Fixed a bug where only some chat participants showed during a chat
    room session
-   Fixed a bug where you could not delete nested folders from Resources
-   Fixed a bug where double-clicking on the \'Save\' button in the
    Gradebook causes an error
-   Made it so that an updated assignment due date is reflected in the
    Gradebook

## Isidore 2.2.3 - June 2009 {#isidore_2.2.3___june_2009}

-   Added the functionality so that instructors can see drafts of
    assignments created by other instructors
-   Fixed WebDAV errors when copying folders

## Isidore 2.2.2 - June 2009 {#isidore_2.2.2___june_2009}

-   Fixed the bug where users would intermittently get a \'FAIL\' screen
    instead of the Forums page

## Isidore 2.2.1 - June 2009 {#isidore_2.2.1___june_2009}

-   Improved speed within the Messages tool when sending messages to the
    entire class list
-   Fixed the bug where modifying topic settings produces an error
-   Added a \'Sent To\' column within the \'Sent\' folder in the
    Messages tool

## Isidore 2.2.0\* - April 2009 {#isidore_2.2.0___april_2009}

-   Added \'drag and drop\' functionality to the sort function of the
    Gradebook
-   Fixed a bug where you could not open or view the question pools
-   Fixed a bug where the quick create functionality with creating
    question pools didn\'t work in the Tests & Quizzes tool

## Isidore 2.1.8 - April 2009 {#isidore_2.1.8___april_2009}

-   Installed SSL certificate on Sakai server
-   Added allow retake option to the scores page in Tests & Quizzes

## Isidore 2.1.7 - March 2009 {#isidore_2.1.7___march_2009}

-   Added information during the site creation process letting
    instructors know that they need to create separate sites for each
    course unless they want the sites to be merged
-   Fixed a bug where if a user has created a personal html page to be
    their Site Info page, it copies over to the new site.
-   Added functionality for copying over forums and topics when
    duplicating a site
-   Improved speed of loading audio resources in Tests & Quizzes

## Isidore 2.1.6 - March 2009 {#isidore_2.1.6___march_2009}

-   Fixed a bug where instructors could not view students\' audio files
    or attachments in Tests & Quizzes
-   Fixed a bug where saving before auto-save runs causes an error
-   Added functionality for instructors to duplicate an existing site

## Isidore 2.1.5 - March 2009 {#isidore_2.1.5___march_2009}

-   Added auto-save functionality to Tests & Quizzes
-   Added an Isidore help video to all users\' My Workspace tabs
-   Improved page load speed of the Gradebook

## Isidore 2.1.4 - February 2009 {#isidore_2.1.4___february_2009}

-   Added an option to allow TA\'s full access to the Gradebook
-   Improved page load speed in Gradebook

## Isidore 2.1.3 - February 2009 {#isidore_2.1.3___february_2009}

-   Added an option to manually assign zeros in Tests & Quizzes

## Isidore 2.1.2 - February 2009 {#isidore_2.1.2___february_2009}

-   Fixed a bug where you could not delete content within Modules
-   Improved functionality within the import/export feature in Modules
-   Fixed the paste from Word feature in Forums

## Isidore 2.1.1 - January 2009 {#isidore_2.1.1___january_2009}

-   Added feature to publish sites 2 days prior to the start of the
    semester

## Isidore 2.5.10 - November 2010 {#isidore_2.5.10___november_2010}

-   Added functionality so that Schedule items can be copied when
    duplicating or importing from a site
-   Added functionality so that items in the Forums tool can be copied
    when duplicating or importing from a site
-   Fixed a bug where special instructions comments weren\'t coming
    through when sites were created or rosters were requested
-   Fixed a bug in Site Stats where the only tool listed was the
    Resources tool
-   Fixed a bug in the Modules tool where the replace function in the
    Import from Site feature acted like a merge
-   Improved the text instructions for duplicating a site during the
    site creation process

## Isidore 2.5.9 - November 2010 {#isidore_2.5.9___november_2010}

-   Renamed the \'Page Order\' link in Site Info to Rename/Reorder Tools
-   Linked the question mark button in My Evaluations to the My
    Evaluations help documentation
-   Added help documentation in the Assignments tool for bulk
    upload/download
-   Rearranged the students\' view of graded assignments (put
    instructor\'s comments and attachments at the top of the page)
-   Enhanced the statistics/item analysis pages for assessments that use
    question pools
-   Linked the question mark button in the Elluminate tool to the
    Elluminate help documentation
-   Added Isidore\'s current server time to the bottom of all Isidore
    pages
-   Updated Isidore\'s Features page to reflect the current tool set

## Isidore 2.5.8 - October 2010 {#isidore_2.5.8___october_2010}

-   Fixed a bug in Tests & Quizzes that didn\'t allow you to export an
    assessment that had more than 255 columns
-   Improved the way that images were displayed in the FCK editor (now
    alphabetical)
-   Fixed a bug in Resources where a \"missing key\" message was
    displayed
-   Improved the text to add official and non-official participants to
    your site
-   Created Elluminate help documentation
-   Fixed a bug in the Gradebook where TA permissions were inaccurate
    when they were set to \"view\" level
-   Fixed a bug in Tests & Quizzes where changing the feedback settings
    erased the release and retract dates
-   Deleted excess years in the Assignments tool (didn\'t need the years
    2002 - 2007)

## Isidore 2.5.7a - September 2010 {#isidore_2.5.7a___september_2010}

-   Fixed an issue with the Home pages tool not being able to interpret
    html code

## Isidore 2.5.7 - September 2010 {#isidore_2.5.7___september_2010}

-   Added functionality to the Gradebook tool so that when a site is
    duplicated, all gradebook categories and weighting and the order of
    gradebook items remain intact
-   Added a new feature to \'My Evaluations\' so that the ideal scale
    point can be at the top or bottom -OR- left or right
-   Fixed an issue with the Site Stats tool not recording data

## Isidore 2.5.6 - August 2010 {#isidore_2.5.6___august_2010}

-   Added functionality for streaming media links (mms://) to be added
    to the Modules tool
-   Fixed a bug in Tests & Quizzes that caused the student assessment
    timer to show inaccurate time
-   Added an \"average score\" option to the Tests & Quizzes tool
-   Added a new feature so students and instructors can view all
    assessment submissions in the Tests & Quizzes tool

## Isidore 2.5.5 - August 2010 {#isidore_2.5.5___august_2010}

-   Added a feature where students who drop a class will automatically
    be dropped from the Isidore site
-   Added \"forgot username?\" \"forgot password?\" links to the Isidore
    login page
-   Added Elluminate integration

## Isidore 2.5.4 - July 2010 {#isidore_2.5.4___july_2010}

-   Fixed a bug in the Modules tool where some of the content sections
    would be missing (or had an invalid link) when a site was being
    imported or duplicated
-   Added a picture icon to the \'My Evaluations\' tool

## Isidore 2.5.3 - July 2010 {#isidore_2.5.3___july_2010}

-   Added a new, more concise description of \'model answer\' to Tests &
    Quizzes
-   Re-added embedded flash player in Tests & Quizzes for audio
    submissions
-   Added and updated many of the FAQs and help files
-   Added \'forgot username?\' and \'forgot password?\' links within
    Isidore
-   Added text to the Gradebook in order to make people aware that the
    course grade is not an accurate representation unless all zeros had
    been entered

## Isidore 2.5.2 - June 2010 {#isidore_2.5.2___june_2010}

-   Fixed a bug in Forums where apostrophes in a student\'s name would
    cause the statistics page not to load
-   Fixed a bug in Tests & Quizzes where you couldn\'t publish
    assessments that had correct and incorrect answer feedback in a
    question
-   Added an informational page to Tests & Quizzes for students so they
    can successfully submit assessments

## Isidore 2.5.1 - May 2010 {#isidore_2.5.1___may_2010}

-   Fixed a bug in Tests & Quizzes that caused instructor\'s grading
    comments not to be shown
-   Corrected the numeric scale on \'My Evaluations\' reports

## Isidore 2.5.0\* - May 2010 {#isidore_2.5.0___may_2010}

-   Added a new messages and forum posts synoptic to all My Workspace
    sites
-   Enabled a session time-out and expiration warning to the server
-   Fixed a bug where instructors could not create a forum, topic, or
    post

## Isidore 2.4.8 - April 2010 {#isidore_2.4.8___april_2010}

-   Installed the Evaluation System tool into Isidore
-   Implemented a fix so that in the future, username changes will not
    affect Isidore accounts

## Isidore 2.4.7 - April 2010 {#isidore_2.4.7___april_2010}

-   Added functionality so that the links to pictures in question pools
    will be updated when duplicating or importing from a site
-   Added functionality so that links to pictures in tests & quizzes
    will be updated when duplicating or importing from a site

## Isidore 2.4.6 - March 2010 {#isidore_2.4.6___march_2010}

-   Added functionality so that syllabi can be copied when duplicating
    or importing from a site
-   Added functionality so that assignments can be copied when
    duplicating or importing from a site
-   Added functionality so that announcements can be copied when
    duplicating or importing from a site

## Isidore 2.4.5 - March 2010 {#isidore_2.4.5___march_2010}

-   Made some changes so that links to files and pictures would not be
    broken when importing from sites or duplicating sites
-   Increased student answer length in Tests & Quizzes tool
-   Fixed a bug where hitting the \'reset selection\' link in Tests &
    Quizzes caused intermittent problems

## Isidore 2.4.4 - February 2010 {#isidore_2.4.4___february_2010}

-   Fixed a bug where auto-save in Tests & Quizzes caused duplicate
    records
-   Fixed a bug where the upload all function in Assignments
    sporadically didn\'t work (when using Firefox)
-   Fixed a bug in the Blogs tool where saving a blank draft caused an

## Isidore 2.4.3 - February 2010 {#isidore_2.4.3___february_2010}

-   Fixed a bug where you couldn\'t move question pools
-   Added a new feature to hide the open and close dates from the main

-   Fixed a bug where a dollar sign (\$) in the answer box in fill in
    the blank type questions caused an error in Tests & Quizzes

## Isidore 2.4.2 - January 2010 {#isidore_2.4.2___january_2010}

-   Fixed a bug where exporting assessments from a large site fails

`     ``<text bytes="1911" sha1="1x9jgj9qf7awhywleqtalqfu7lq9xob" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`Zoom can be accessed with an integration within Isidore, but also just using a web browser outside of Isidore. `

### To access Zoom inside of Isidore as an Instructor: {#to_access_zoom_inside_of_isidore_as_an_instructor}

**Note: You must be an instructor in an Isidore site to add it to an
Isidore site.**

1.  Navigate to the course site where you\'d like to install Zoom.
2.  Follow the steps to [Add/Remove Tools](Add/Remove_Tools "wikilink").
    Zoom is currently in the **Core Tools** section.
3.  Once the tool has been added, click on the tool in the tool menu.
4.  If it is your first time visiting the tool, you will see a message:
    \"We have sent an email to \[your email address\]. Please check your
    inbox for more information and next steps.
5.  Follow the [steps to activate your Zoom
    account](Activate_Zoom_Account "wikilink"), then return to Isidore
    and refresh the tool to set up meetings.

### To access Zoom inside of Isidore as a Student: {#to_access_zoom_inside_of_isidore_as_a_student}

1.  Navigate to the course site where your instructor is hosting the
    meeting.
2.  Click on the Zoom tool in the tool menu.
3.  Recordings and meeting links will be available here.

### To access Zoom outside of Isidore (as a student, instructor, staff, or guest): {#to_access_zoom_outside_of_isidore_as_a_student_instructor_staff_or_guest}

1.  Open a browser.
2.  Type in the following web address: go.udayton.edu/zoom
3.  On this page, you have several options. We recommend clicking the
    **Sign in** option if you have never set up your Zoom account
    before.
    -   If you would like to connect to a meeting-in-progress, click on
        the **Join** button. You will be prompted to enter the Meeting
        ID number.
    -   If you would like to host a meeting on-the-fly, click on the
        **Host** button. Anyone at UD may host a meeting. You may need
        to first [ activate your
        account](Activate_Zoom_Account "wikilink"). When you log in
        using single sign-on (SSO), the meeting room with launch.
    -   If you would like to manage your account settings or schedule a
        meeting in the future, click on the **Sign in** button.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Zoom](Zoom "wikilink") page

`     ``<text bytes="1606" sha1="951c66l7qm48260grz97xugikom1er6" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`The Accessibility Checker allows you to inspect your content for common accessibility issues, such as missing headers or alt text. It suggests recommended fixes that you can either apply or ignore.`

To run the accessibility checker in Isidore:

1.  Navigate to where you\'ve typed some content into the html editor in
    Isidore. The html editor is available in most tools (Announcements,
    Syllabus, Lessons, etc.).
2.  Flip into edit mode so that the html/WYSIWYG editor is visible.
3.  Click on the icon for the accessibility checker. It looks like a
    person with their arms outstretched in a circle: ![Accessibility
    Checker Icon - person with arms outstretched in a
    circle](A11ychecker.png "Accessibility Checker Icon - person with arms outstretched in a circle")
4.  The accessibility checker will run and will pop up if any errors are
    discovered. It guides you in fixing some of the errors. One example
    may be a text box for you to enter alt text for an image. You can
    either click on \"Quick Fix\" or \"Ignore\". You need to address
    these errors in order for your content to be considered accessible.
5.  Ensure that you save your changes.

If you have any questions about the errors or how to make your content
accessible, please contact the Center for Online Learning via (937)
229-5039 or <onlinelearning@udayton.edu>.

Sign in with
Facebook](ActivateYourAccount.png "Three activation options: Sign in with SSO, Sign in with Google, or Sign in with Facebook")

1.  Choose the **Sign in with SSO** (single sign-on) option to access
    all Zoom features.
2.  You will be prompted to log in with your UD credentials.
    -   If you have two-factor authentication enabled, you will need to
        approve the login request on your two-factor device.
3.  Once you have activated your account, you will be taken to your Zoom
    account settings page.

To link to (add) an assignment:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Add Content** and select **Link to an assignment** under the
    \"Linked or Embedded Items\" heading.
3.  This will give you a list of all assignments already posted in the
    Assignments tool.
4.  Click on the radio button to the left of the assignment you wish to
    add and click **Use selected item**.

To create a new assignment, use the link **Create new assignment using
Assignments** at the top of the page. This will call the Assignments
tool, and allow you to create a new assignment or modify an existing
one. When you are ready to add the new assignment, click the **Continue
with Add Assignment, after you have created the new assignment** link at
the top. That will return you to the list of assignments, where you can
choose the assignment you just created.

## Edit an Assignment {#edit_an_assignment}

To edit an assignment:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the
    assignment you would like to modify.
3.  This will open up an *Edit Item* box on your screen. The options
    available for modification are as follows:
    -   Under \"Display Settings\":
        -   **Item Name** - Change the name of the text on the link to
            your assignment on the main Lessons page.
        -   **Item Description** - Change/add a description to your
            assignment, which will appear beneath the link to the
            assignment.
        -   **Change Assignment** - Change the Assignment to a different
            one.
        -   **Edit Assignment** - Modify this assignment within the
            Assignments tool.
    -   Under \"Layout & Style\":
        -   **Indent level** - Change how much the item is indented or
            outdented.
        -   **Custom CSS class** - Use your own custom css file for
            styling (advanced users only).
    -   Under \"Prerequisites & Requirements\"
        -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are
            Completed** - Select this option if you would like it to be
            accessible only after previously required items have been
            completed.
        -   **Require that the student submit this assignment** - Select
            this option to make this item a required item; students must
            complete required items before progressing in a Lessons
            plan.
        -   **Require that the student receive \_\_\_\_ points on this
            assignment** - Select this option to make it necessary to
            score a certain number of points on the assessment to
            continue. This option can only be selected if the item is
            Required.
    -   Under \"Visbility & Access\":
        -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If
            you have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make
            this assignment visible only to some groups. Students who
            are not in one of the checked sections of groups will not
            see this item on their page at all.
4.  To save your changes, click **Update Item**.

## Delete an Assignment {#delete_an_assignment}

To delete an assignment:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete** (trash can icon) to the right of the assignment you
    would like to remove.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Add a new attendance item {#add_a_new_attendance_item}

There are two ways to create new attendance items. You can either create
new items with the \"Add\" tab, or you can click the \"Take Attendance
Now\" button at the top of the \"Attendance\" tab.

#### Creating Items from the Add Tab {#creating_items_from_the_add_tab}

To add an attendance item:

1.  Navigate to the **Attendance** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Make sure you\'re on the **Attendance** tab.
3.  Click on the **Add** tab.
4.  In the **Add/Edit Attendance Item** section, enter a name for your
    new attendance item.
5.  Optional: Enter a date and time for your attendance item.
6.  Press **Create** or press **Create & Add Another** if you want to
    create more items.
7.  Your new Attendance item will now appear in the Attendance Items
    list.

#### Create Items from the Take Attendance Now button {#create_items_from_the_take_attendance_now_button}

To add an attendance item using the \"Take Attendance Now\" button:

1.  Navigate to the **Attendance** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Make sure you\'re on the **Attendance** tab.
3.  Click on the **Take Attendance Now** button above the table on the
    **Attendance** tab.
4.  An attendance item will be created with the date and time of when
    you pressed the button.

## Edit an existing attendance item {#edit_an_existing_attendance_item}

To edit an attendance item:

1.  Navigate to the **Attendance** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Make sure you\'re on the **Attendance** tab.
3.  Click on the **Actions** button and select **Edit** next to the
    attendance item you would like to edit.
4.  Make the desired changes to the item and click on **Save Changes**.

## Delete an attendance item {#delete_an_attendance_item}

To delete an attendance item:

1.  Navigate to the **Attendance** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Make sure you\'re on the **Attendance** tab.
3.  Click on the **Actions** button and select **Delete** next to the
    attendance item you would like to delete.
    -   *Note: Attendance records are not recoverable. Do not delete any
        attendance items that you may need.*
4.  Click on **OK** to confirm deletion.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Attendance](Attendance "wikilink") page

## Adding a room {#adding_a_room}

To add a room:

1.  Navigate to the **Chat Room** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Add Room**.
3.  Enter the chat room title and description in the text boxes.
4.  Under \"Recent Chat Display\", use the radio buttons to select how
    many previous messages to display: \<br /\>

:   

    :   {\| class=\"wikitable\"

\|- \| **Show no Message History** \| Displays no previous messages \|-
\| **Show all messages** \| Displays all previous messages \|- \| **Show
the last 10 messages** \| Displays the last ten messages by default; you
can change the number of messages \|- \| **Show messages from the past 3
days** \| Displays all messages from the past three days by default; you
can change the number of days \|}

:   

    :   You can also choose whether to allow site participants to change
        display settings for their own chat windows.

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```

:   

    :   **Note**: No matter how many messages you choose to display, all
        messages are archived automatically, and are kept until you
        choose to clear the chat room\'s history. To do so, under the
        chat room\'s title, click **Clear History**, and then
        **Delete**. The **Clear History** option appears only when a
        chat room has messages in its archive.

\<ol start=\"6\"\> \<li\>Click **Update Options**. Your new room will
now appear under \"Manage Rooms\" in the list of available chat rooms.
To make your new room appear by default when participants click **Chat
Room**, click **Set as Default**.\</li\> \</ol\>

## Editing a room {#editing_a_room}

To edit a room\'s title, description, or number of messages displayed:

1.  Navigate to the **Chat Room** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Options**.
3.  Under the name of the room you wish to edit, click **Edit**.
4.  Change the chat room title or description, or use the radio buttons
    to select how many previous messages to display.
5.  When you are finished, click **Update Options**.

*Note: To change the room that loads by default when participants click
**Chat Room**, in **Options**, under \"Manage Rooms\", find the room and
click **Set as Default**.*

## Deleting a room {#deleting_a_room}

To delete a room:

1.  Navigate to the **Chat Room** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Options**.
3.  Under the name of the room you wish to delete, click **Delete**.
4.  Confirm the deletion by clicking **Delete** again.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Chat Room](Chat_Room "wikilink") page

The citation lists feature allows you to search library resources (e.g.,
WorldCat, Academic Search \[EBSCO\], JSTOR), as well as create and
manage citations and persistent links to articles and other online
items.

## Adding a New Citation List {#adding_a_new_citation_list}

To create a new citation list:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on **Actions**, select **Create Citation List**. **Note:**
    before this step, please make sure you click on the folder you want
    to add the citation list to.
3.  You now have several options to add citations to your list:
    -   [Search Library
        Resources](#Searching_Library_Resources "wikilink"): Search
        library catalog, article databases, and other resources.
    -   [Search Google Scholar](#Searching_Google_Scholar "wikilink"):
        Search a world-wide database of scholarly resources, and save
        search results to this citation list.
    -   [Create New Citation](#Creating_a_New_Citation "wikilink"): Add
        a new citation by typing in data. Click on **Save Citation**.
        Click on **Continue**.
    -   [Import
        Citations](#Importing_Citations_in_RIS_Format "wikilink"):
        Import citations in RIS format from EndNote, RefWorks, or other
        citation management tools.
4.  Once you have added citations to your list, give the citation list a
    name and click on the **Finish** button.

## Editing Your Citation List {#editing_your_citation_list}

To edit your citation list:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the citation list you want
    to edit and click on **Edit Citation List**.
3.  Make the desired changes.
4.  To save your settings, click **Done Editing List** at the bottom of
    the page.

## Deleting your Citation List {#deleting_your_citation_list}

To delete your citation list:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the citation list you want
    to remove and click on **Move to Trash**.
3.  Click **Remove**.

Your citation list will be displayed in your Resources tool. Citations
will display in alphabetical order by citation title. \<br /\>\<br /\>
Return to the main [Resources](Resources "wikilink") page

## Adding a new folder {#adding_a_new_folder}

By default, your Drop Box has one folder in it containing your name.

To add a subfolder:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Next to the existing folder, from the **Actions** menu, choose
    **Create Folders**.
3.  Type a name for the folder in the box provided.
4.  You can add additional folders from this screen by clicking **Add
    Another Folder**.\<br /\>*Note: To remove a folder from the list of
    folders to add, click the red **X** next to it.*
5.  Click **Create Folders Now**.

## Adding a new Drop Box item {#adding_a_new_drop_box_item}

When you add a new Drop Box item, you may have the option of sending an
email notification. This option can be enabled or disabled by the site
instructor/owner.

Instructors will see an orange star highlighting Drop Box folders that
have recently been updated.

Follow the instructions below for the type of item you want to add.

### File upload {#file_upload}

To upload an existing document or other file from your computer:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Next to the folder to which you want to upload the file, from the
    **Actions** menu, select **Upload Files**.
3.  For each item, click **Browse**, select a file to upload, and then
    click **Open**.\<br /\>**Note**: Filenames that include certain
    characters cannot be accepted.
4.  Next to \"Display Name\", type a title for the item (if you don\'t
    add a title, the filename will be used for the title).
5.  To upload more than one file, click **Add Another File**.\<br /\>You
    can add any number of files at once, as long as the total file size
    does not exceed 250 MB.\<br /\>**Note**: To remove a file from the
    list of files to add, click the red **X** next to it.
6.  Click **Upload Files Now** to finish.

### URL

To specify a URL to a web site as the Drop Box item:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Next the folder to which you want to add the URL, from the
    **Actions** menu, select **Add Web Links (URLs)**.
3.  For each item, type the URL in the box. (You may omit the <http://>
    prefix.)
4.  Add a title for your URL link item. If you don\'t add a title, the
    URL will be used as the title of the item.
5.  To add another URL, click **Add Another Web Link**.\<br /\>**Note**:
    To remove a URL from the list of URLs to add, click the red **X**
    next to it.
6.  Click **Add Web Links Now** to finish.

### HTML page {#html_page}

To create and display an HTML document:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Next to the folder to which you want to add the HTML page, from the
    **Actions** menu, select **Create HTML Page**.
3.  Enter the content of your page and click **Continue**.
4.  Enter a title in the \"Name\" text box.
5.  Click **Finish** to add your HTML page to Drop Box.

### Text document {#text_document}

To create and display a plain text document:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Next to the folder to which you want to add the document, from the
    **Actions** menu, select **Create Text Document**.
3.  Type the content of your text document and click **Continue**.
4.  Enter a title in the \"Name\" text box.
5.  Click **Finish** to add your text document to Drop Box.

## Editing a Drop Box item {#editing_a_drop_box_item}

To edit a drop box item:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
    -   To update the content of items (that were created in Isidore),
        choose **Actions**, and then click **Edit Content**. Make your
        changes, and then click **Continue**.
    -   To update a file (that was not created in Isidore), you will
        have to make the changes and save them on your computer, and
        then upload a new version. From the **Actions** menu, select
        **Upload New Version**.

## Deleting a Drop Box item {#deleting_a_drop_box_item}

To delete an item from Drop Box:

1.  Navigate to the **Drop Box** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  To remove one item at a time, choose **Actions**, and then click
    **Remove**. To remove several items at a time, mark their
    corresponding checkboxes, and then, above the list of items, click
    **Remove**.
3.  To confirm that you want to remove the item(s) listed, click
    **Remove**. Or, to cancel, click **Cancel**.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Drop Box](Drop_Box "wikilink") page

## Uploading a File {#uploading_a_file}

To upload a new file:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on **Actions** and click on **Add File**. *Note: before this
    step, please click on the title of the folder you wish to upload the
    file to.*
3.  Select **Upload Files**.
4.  Click within the rectangle with dotted lines OR drag files into the
    rectangle.
    -   Browse to where the file is stored on your computer and select
        the file.
    -   Click \"Open\".
5.  When you are finished, click **Continue**.

## Editing a File {#editing_a_file}

To edit a file:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the file you\'re wanting to
    edit and click **Upload New File**.
3.  Click on **Choose File** or **Browse**.
4.  Browse to where the file is stored on your computer and select the
    file.
5.  Click **Open**.
6.  When you are finished, click **Upload New Version Now**.

## Deleting a File {#deleting_a_file}

To remove a file:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the file you want to delete
    and click on **Move to Trash**.
3.  Click on **Remove**.

`     ``<text bytes="2514" sha1="h16mtaw8co5xf2ob7k4e8zj3epgnumm" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`== Adding Flashcards ==`

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool in the tool menu.
2.  Locate the card set to which you\'d like to add flashcards.
3.  Click on the card set\'s title.
4.  Click on the **Add New Card** button.
5.  Side A of a given flashcard can be one of the following types:
    -   Text: Choose this type to enter text on Side A.
    -   Image: Choose this type to provide a URL to an image.
    -   MP3: Choose this type to provide a URL to an MP3.
    -   Video: Choose this type to provide a URL to a video.
    -   **Note:** URLs may come from any website, but you may also
        upload files into your the Resources tool in Isidore sites. See
        directions
        \[<https://ewiki.udayton.edu/isidore/Add/Edit/Delete_Files>\|
        for uploading files to Resources\] and
        \[<https://ewiki.udayton.edu/isidore/Find_the_URL_of_an_Item>\|
        how to find the URL of a file in Resources\]. If adding a
        Youtube URL, you must add the full URL to the video and not the
        short link in order for the video to appear.
    -   **Note:** If the flashcards will be used in multiple sites, it
        is recommended that any files that are stored in Isidore\'s
        Resources tool be publicly accessible so people in multiples
        sites can access them. See directions
        \[<https://ewiki.udayton.edu/isidore/Make_Resources_Publicly_Accessible>\|
        for making a publicly accessible folder in Resources\].
    -   **Note:** Each side of a flashcard can ONLY be of the type that
        is selected. In other words, if \"image\" is selected, it cannot
        also include text on that site. Similarly, if \"text\" is
        selected, a video may not be added.
6.  Side B of a given flashcard can only be text or an image.
7.  When you have information for both Side A and Side B, click **Add
    Card** to add the card to the set. Click **Cancel** to discard your
    changes.

## Editing Flashcards {#editing_flashcards}

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool in the tool menu.
2.  Locate the card set where you\'d like to edit flashcards.
3.  Click on the card set\'s title.
4.  Click on the **Edit** button next to the flashcard you\'d like to
    edit.
5.  Make the necessary changes to the card, then press **Update Card**
    to save your changes. Click **Cancel** to discard your changes.

## Deleting Flashcards {#deleting_flashcards}

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool in the tool menu.
2.  Locate the card set where you\'d like to delete flashcards.
3.  Click on the card set\'s title.
4.  Click on the trashcan button next to the card you would like to
    delete. Press **OK** to delete the card. Press **Cancel** to keep
    the card.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Flashcards](Flashcards "wikilink")

## Adding a New Folder {#adding_a_new_folder_1}

By default, your Resources area has one folder in it, named after your
course site.

To add a subfolder:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click **Actions** and click on **Create Folders**.
3.  Next to \"Folder Name\", enter a title for your folder.\<br
    /\>*Note: To remove a folder from the list of folders to add, click
    the red **X** next to it.*
4.  When you are finished, click **Create Folders Now**.

## Editing a Folder {#editing_a_folder}

To edit a folder:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button to the right of the folder and click
    on **Edit Details**.
3.  Make your desired changes.
4.  Click on **Update**.

## Reordering Folder Contents {#reordering_folder_contents}

To reorder items in a folder:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button to the right of the folder and click
    on **Reorder**.
3.  Drag files up or down to reorder them.
4.  Click on **Save**.

## Deleting a Folder {#deleting_a_folder}

To remove a folder:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button to the right of the folder and click
    on **Move to Trash**.
3.  Click on **Remove**.

`     ``<text bytes="2890" sha1="mfou8zzfhnwg9uesvyoeirjp5k0a5bx" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`== Link to (add) a Forum or Topic ==`

To link to (add) a forum or topic:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click the **Add Content** and select **Link to a Forum or Topic**
    under the \"Linked or Embedded Items\" heading.
3.  This will give you a list of forum topics already posted (not in
    draft mode) in your Forums tool.
4.  Click the radio button next to the one you wish to add and then
    click **Use Selected Item**.

To create a new topic, use the link **Create new topic** at the top of
the page. If you have more than one forum tool in your site, you may see
a separate link for each tool. This will call the forum tool, and allow
you to create a new topic or modify an existing one. When you are ready
to add the new topic, click the **Continue with Add Forum Topic, after
you have created the new item** link at the top. That will return you to
the list of topics, where you can choose the topic you just created.

## Edit a Forum or Topic {#edit_a_forum_or_topic}

To edit a forum or topic:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the topic or
    forum you would like to modify.
3.  This will open up an **Edit Item** box on your screen. The options
    available for modification are as follows:
    -   Under \"Display Settings\":
        -   **Item Name** - Change the name of the text on the link to
            your topic on the main Lessons page.
        -   **Item Description** - Change/add a description to your
            topic, which will appear beneath the link to the topic.
        -   **Change Forum Topic** - Change the topic to a different one
            in your Forums tool.
        -   **Edit Forum Topic** - Modify the forum or topic in the
            Forums tool.
    -   Under \"Layout & Style\":
        -   **Indent level** - Change how much the item is indented or
            outdented.
        -   **Custom CSS class** - Use your own custom css file for
            styling (advanced users only).
    -   Under \"Prerequisites & Requirements\":
        -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are
            Completed** - Select this option if you would like it to
            appear/be accessible only after previously \'Required\'
            items have been completed/accessed.
        -   **Require that the student submit a posting to this
            topic** - Select this option to make this item a
            \'Required\' item for later on in the Lessons plan.
    -   Under \"Visibility & Access\":
        -   **Edit the groups for which this topic should be shown** -
            If you have groups or sections in the site, allows you to
            make this topic visible only to some groups. Students who
            are not in one of the checked sections of groups will not
            see this item on their page at all.
4.  To save your changes, click **Update Item**.

## Delete a Forum or Topic {#delete_a_forum_or_topic}

To delete a forum or topic:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete** (trash can icon) next to the forum topic you want
    to remove.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

`     ``<text bytes="2414" sha1="lmnavy2rwvmakf628my3vt9cicy5rzs" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`== Adding a new gradebook item ==`

To add a new gradebook item:

1.  Navigate to the **Gradebook** tool in your course site.
2.  Click **Add Gradebook Item**.
3.  On the Add Gradebook Item(s) screen, fill in the following
    information:
    -   Title: A title is required for all gradebook items.
    -   Point value: For points gradebooks, enter a total point value
        for the Gradebook item. This must be greater than zero. Decimal
        values are permitted to two decimal places.
    -   Whether the item is extra credit.
    -   Due Date: You can optionally designate a due date for a
        gradebook item. You can manually enter the due date (e.g.,
        09/28/07), or click the calendar icon to select a date from a
        pop-up calendar.
    -   Category: If you have created a category, you can optionally
        assign an item to a category using the drop-down list.
    -   To allow students to view the grade for this item, check
        \"Release this item to Students?\". You can change this option
        later. (If this box is checked when you enter grades, students
        will see their grades as soon as you click Save Changes.) To
        exclude this item from the course grade calculation, uncheck
        \"Include this item in course grade calculations\". You can
        change this option later. Note: you cannot have something
        included in the course grade without releasing it to students.
4.  To create the item, click **Create**.

## Edit an existing gradebook item {#edit_an_existing_gradebook_item}

To edit an existing gradebook item:

1.  Navigate to the **Gradebook** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the item you wish to edit in the gradebook columns.
3.  Near the lower right of the item title, click on the downward-facing
    arrow and select **Edit Item Details**.
4.  Make the desired changes to the item and click on **Save Changes**.

*Note: You may also edit a gradebook item\'s information on the
[Gradebook Items](View_Gradebook_Items "wikilink") page.*

## Delete a gradebook item {#delete_a_gradebook_item}

*Please note that you no longer have to delete gradebook items
individually. Please see the [Delete Multiple Gradebook
Items](Delete_Multiple_Gradebook_Items "wikilink") page to delete
multiple items at once.*

To delete a gradebook item:

1.  Navigate to the **Gradebook** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the item you wish to edit in the gradebook columns.
3.  Near the lower right of the item title, click on the downward-facing
    arrow and select **Delete Item**.
4.  Click on **Delete** when the confirmation page appears.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Gradebook](Gradebook "wikilink") page

## Adding an HTML Page {#adding_an_html_page}

To create an HTML page in your Resources area:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button and select **Create HTML Page**.
    *Note: before doing this, make sure you\'re in the folder you wish
    to add the HTML page to.*
3.  Use the HTML editor to create your page, and then click
    **Continue**.
4.  Enter a title and an optional description in the text areas
    provided.
5.  Click **Finish**.

## Editing an HTML Page {#editing_an_html_page}

To edit an HTML page in your Resources area:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the HTML page you want to
    edit and click on **Edit Content**.
3.  Use the HTML editor to make changes, and then click **Continue**.

## Deleting an HTML Page {#deleting_an_html_page}

To remove an HTML page in your Resources area:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the HTML page you want to
    remove and select **Move to Trash**.
3.  Click **Remove**.

## Adding a news feed {#adding_a_news_feed}

To add a news feed:

1.  In the course site\'s menubar, click on the **Site Info** tool.
2.  Click on **Add / Remove Tools**.
3.  Check the box next to **News**.
4.  Click on **Continue**.
5.  Enter a title of the news tool (i.e. CNN US News) and paste in the
    RSS address in the \"URL Channel\" text box.
6.  Click on **Continue**.
7.  Click on **Finish**.
8.  The news feed you added will appear in the menu bar on the left-hand
    side of your course under **News**.

## Editing a news feed {#editing_a_news_feed}

To edit a news feed:

1.  Navigate to the **News** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on **Edit**.
3.  Enter a tool title for the news feed (i.e. CNN US News).
4.  Paste the RSS link into the RSS feed URL text box. The RSS URL
    usually looks something like
    \"<http://rss.cnn.com/rss/cnn_us.rss>\".
5.  Click on **Save configuration**.
6.  You should now see articles from the news source you added.

## Deleting a news feed {#deleting_a_news_feed}

To delete a news feed:

1.  In the course site\'s menubar, click on the **Site Info** tool.
2.  Click on **Add / Remove Tools**.
3.  Uncheck the box next to the **News** tool you want to remove.
4.  Click on **Continue**.
5.  Click on **Finish**.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [News](News "wikilink") page

## Adding Participants {#adding_participants}

To add a participant:

1.  Navigate to the **Site Info** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Add Participants**.
3.  Select whether or not the participant you\'re adding has an official
    UD email address.
    -   For participants with official e-mail addresses, under **Adding
        Official UD Participants**, type in the participant\'s UD
        username or ID number. If you wish to add more than one
        participant, enter each item on a separate line.
    -   For participants without official e-mail addresses, under
        **Adding Guest Participants**, enter their email address,
        lastname, and firstname. If you wish to add more than one
        participant, enter items on separate lines.
4.  Click **Continue**.
5.  Under \"Participants to be added:\", select a role for each user.
    *Note: Participants without an official UD account can only be added
    as students due to FERPA and security concerns.* Descriptions of the
    roles are below. \<br /\>**More detailed information about roles can
    be found on the [Understand Roles](Understand_Roles "wikilink")
    page.**
    -   **Instructor**: Can read, revise, delete and add both content
        and participants to a site
    -   **SI Leader**: Supplemental Instruction Leader who can read
        content and post announcements
    -   **Student**: Can read content and add content to a site where
        appropriate
    -   **TA-Grading**: Teaching assistant who can read content and
        grade in Assignments/Tests & Quizzes/Gradebook
    -   **TA-Limited**: Teaching assistant who can read content
6.  Choose whether you would like to notify the participants by email
    that they\'ve been added
7.  If you\'re adding someone with the Student role, you need to check
    the box to acknowledge that the individual you\'re adding is not
    officially registered for the course.
8.  Click on **Finish**.
9.  The new participants will appear in your participant list in the
    Site Info tool.

## Editing Participants/Making Participants Inactive {#editing_participantsmaking_participants_inactive}

To edit a participant:

1.  Navigate to the **Site Info** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Manage Participants**.
3.  In the participant list, you can change a participant\'s role using
    the drop-down list under \"Role\". \<br /\>**More detailed
    information about roles can be found on the [Understand
    Roles](Understand_Roles "wikilink") page.**
4.  Under \"Status\", you can use the drop-down list to change a
    participant\'s status; choose **Active** or **Inactive**. An
    inactive student remains a member of the site, but no longer has
    access. (You can use this to exclude students from a site who would
    otherwise have access through an associated class list, and
    therefore cannot be removed.)
5.  Click **Update Participants**.

## Removing Participants {#removing_participants}

*If a participant is part of the official roster maintained by the
Registrar\'s Office, that participant cannot be removed. They can,
however, be made inactive so that they no longer have access to the
course page.*

To remove a participant:

1.  Navigate to the **Site Info** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Manage Participants**.
3.  In the participant list, under \"Remove\", check the box next to
    each participant you\'d like to remove.
4.  Click **Update Participants**.

## Get participant\'s official username {#get_participants_official_username}

To retrieve a participant\'s official username:

1.  Navigate your web browser to
    [porches.udayton.edu](https://porches.udayton.edu).
2.  Enter your UD username and password, and click **Login**.
3.  From the Front Porch tab, scroll down the page to where the People
    Search is located.
4.  Ensure that the People tab is selected.
5.  In the \"Search by Last Name\" box, type the last name of the
    participant you wish to find and click **Search**
6.  The names of all persons affiliated with the University with that
    last name will appear, alphabetized by first name.
7.  Locate the full name of the participant you wish to find.
8.  The official username will be all of the characters before the @
    symbol in the \"University E-mail\" section.

To link to (add) a quiz or assessment:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Add Content** and select **Link to a test or quiz** under
    the \"Linked or Embedded Items\" heading.
3.  This will give you a list of assessments already published in the
    **Tests & Quizzes** tool.
4.  Click the radio button next to the assessment you wish to add and
    then click **Use selected item**.

To create a new quiz, use the link **Create new quiz using Tests and
Quizzes** at the top of the page. This will call the Tests and Quizzes,
and allow you to create a new assignment or modify an existing one. When
you are ready to add the new quiz, click the **Continue with Add Quiz,
after you have created the new quiz** link at the top. That will return
you to the list of quizzes, where you can choose the quiz you just
created.

## Edit a Quiz {#edit_a_quiz}

To edit a quiz or test:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the quiz you
    would like to modify.
3.  This will open up an **Edit Item** box on your screen. The options
    available for modification are as follows:
    -   Under \"Display Settings\":
        -   **Item Name** - Change the name of the text on the link to
            your quiz on the main Lessons page.
        -   **Item Description** - Change/add a description to your
            quiz, which will appear beneath the link to the quiz.
        -   **Change Quiz** - Change the assessment to a different one
            in your Tests & Quizzes section.
        -   **Edit Quiz** - Modify quiz settings in the Tests & Quizzes
            tool.
        -   **Edit Quiz Settings** - Call the Tests and Quizzes tool
            opened to the settings for this quiz, to modify them
    -   Under \"Layout & Style\":
        -   **Indent level** - Change how much the item is indented or
            outdented.
        -   **Custom CSS class** - Use your own custom css file for
            styling (advanced users only).
    -   Under \"Prerequisites & Requirements\":
        -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are
            Completed** - Select this option if you would like it to
            appear/be accessible only after previously \'Required\'
            items have been completed/accessed.
        -   **Require that the student submit this assessment** - Select
            this option to make this item a \'Required\' item for later
            on in the Lessons plan.
        -   **Require that the student receive \_\_\_\_ points on this
            assessment** - Select this option to make it necessary to
            score a certain number of points on the assessment to
            continue. This option can only be selected if the item is
            Required.
    -   Under \"Visibility & Access\":
        -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If
            you have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make
            this quiz visible only to some groups. Students who are not
            in one of the checked sections of groups will not see this
            item on their page at all.
4.  To save your changes, click **Update Item**.

## Delete a Quiz {#delete_a_quiz}

To delete a quiz or test:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete** (trash can icon) to the right of the quiz you would
    like to remove.
3.  Click **Delete** to verify deletion.

Each Lessons tool that you add to your worksite can have multiple pages
associated with it. These pages are referred to as subpages.

To add a subpage:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Add Content** and select **Add Subpage**.
3.  Fill in the text field labeled \"Page title\" with the title of your
    new subpage.
    -   **Choose Existing Page** - Use if you want to link to a Lessons
        page that already exists.
    -   **Next page** - (Not recommended) Should only be used to remove
        the \"Next\" button from the subpage. Students won\'t be able to
        continue to navigate through the subpages.
    -   **Show as button rather thank link** - Displays the subpage as a
        button. If this setting is off, the subpage is displayed as a
        link.
    -   **Button Color** - Select a color for the subpage button.
4.  Click **Create**.
5.  A new subpage button will be added to the page.
6.  Click on the subpage button.
7.  This will take you to a blank Lessons page, where you can add new
    content pieces as you see fit.

## Edit a Subpage {#edit_a_subpage}

To edit information about a subpage:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (paper and pencil icon) to the right of the subpage
    you would like to modify.
3.  The options available for modification are as follows:
    -   Under \"Display Settings\":
        -   **Item Name** - Change the name of the text on the link to
            your resource on the main Lessons page.
        -   **Item Description** - Change/add a description to your
            resource, which will appear beneath the link to the
            resource.
        -   **Change Page** - Should only be used if you want another
            subpage to be shown instead of the current one.
        -   **Next page** - (Not recommended) Should only be used to
            remove the \"Next\" button from the subpage. Students won\'t
            be able to continue to navigate through the subpages.
    -   Under \"Layout & Style\":
        -   **Show as button rather than link** - Displays the subpage
            as a button. If this setting is off, the subpage is
            displayed as a link.
    -   **Button Color** - Select a color for the subpage button.
        -   **Indent level** - Change how much the item is indented or
            outdented.
        -   **Custom CSS class** - Use your own custom css file for
            styling (advanced users only).
    -   Under \"Prerequisites & Requirements:
        -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are
            Completed** - Select this option if you would like it to
            appear/be accessible only after previously \'Required\'
            items have been completed/accessed.
    -   **Require This Item** - Select this option to make this item a
        \'Required\' item for later on in the Lessons plan. Students
        must complete this item before moving on.
    -   Under \"Visibility & Access\":
        -   **Make page inactive until the following date** - Subpage is
            hidden from students until a specific date/time.
        -   **Hide page** - Subpage is hidden from students until it\'s
            unhidden.
    -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If you
        have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make this
        item visible only to some groups. Students who are not in one of
        the checked sections of groups will not see this item on their
        page at all.
4.  To save your changes, click **Update Item**.

## Delete a Subpage {#delete_a_subpage}

To remove a subpage:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete** (trash can icon) to the right of the subpage you
    would like to remove.
3.  Click **Delete** to verify deletion.

## Add Text {#add_text}

To add text to the page:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add Text** under the **Simple
    Content Items** heading.
3.  Enter your text in the rich text editor provided and click **Save**
    at the bottom of the page.

If you have groups or sections in the site, a set of checkboxes will be
shown under the rich text editor. This allows you to make this text
visible only to some groups. Students who are not in one of the checked
sections of groups will not see this item on their page at all.

## Edit Text {#edit_text}

To edit existing text:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the text box.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Save** at the
    bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to your
    page without applying any changes.

## Remove Text {#remove_text}

To remove text:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the text
    box.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Add Text, Videos, or Images {#add_text_videos_or_images}

To add text, videos, or images to the page:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add Text, Video, or Image**
    under the \"Simple Content Items\" heading.
    -   For text, enter your text in the rich-text editor provided and
        click **Save** at the bottom of the page.
    -   For video, click on the **Embed YouTube**, **Insert Warpwire**,
        or **Insert/Edit Movie** icons in the rich-text editor.
        Depending on the option you choose, you\'ll be asked for the
        video URL or to pick a video. Once the video is selected, click
        on **Save** at the bottom of the page.
    -   For images, click on the **Image** icon in the rich-text editor.
        You can upload an image or paste in the URL to the location of
        the image. Be sure to enter a brief description of the image
        into the \"Alternative Text\" box. Click on **Save** at the
        bottom of the page.

If you have groups or sections in the site, a set of checkboxes will be
shown under the rich text editor. This allows you to make the text,
video, or image visible only to some groups. Students who are not in one
of the checked sections of groups will not see this item on their page
at all.

## Edit Text, Videos, or Images {#edit_text_videos_or_images}

To edit text, videos, or images:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the item you
    wish to modify.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Save** at the
    bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to your
    page without applying any changes.

## Remove Text, Videos, or Images {#remove_text_videos_or_images}

To remove text, videos, or images:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the item
    you wish to delete.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Adding a Text Document {#adding_a_text_document}

To create a text document in your **Resources** area:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button and click on **Create Text
    Document**. **Note:** before you do this, make sure you\'re in the
    folder you want to add the text file to.
3.  Type the content of your text document, and then click **Continue**.
4.  Enter a title and an optional description in the text areas
    provided.
5.  Click **Finish**.

## Editing a Text Document {#editing_a_text_document}

To edit a text document in your **Resources** area:

1.  In your site\'s menubar, click **Resources**.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the text document you want
    to edit and select **Edit Content**.
3.  Make the desired changes to the text.
4.  Click on the **Continue** button.

## Deleting a Text Document {#deleting_a_text_document}

To delete a text document in your **Resources** area:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the text document you want
    to remove and click on **Move to Trash**.
3.  Click **Remove**.

## Adding a Web Content Item {#adding_a_web_content_item}

To add a web content item:

1.  In the relevant course site, click **Site Info**.
2.  On the Site Info page, click **Add / Remove Tools**.
3.  Check the box next to Web Content. (If your worksite already
    contains Web Content items, they will be listed with the title you
    gave them, or \"Web Content\" if you did not change the title,
    although you should see an additional empty box labeled Web Content;
    check this one.)
4.  Click **Continue**.
5.  On the \"Customize tools\" screen, enter the following information:
    -   In the \"Title\" field, add a title.
    -   In the \"Source\" field, enter a URL after the \"<http://>\"
        that already appears in the field.
    -   If you\'d like to add more than one item, select the appropriate
        number of items from the \"More Web Content Tools?\" drop-down
        menu.
6.  Click **Continue**. You will see information about the changes you
    have made to your worksite.
7.  Click **Finish**.

\'Note: You may need to click on the web content tool you added to the
course menu bar and click on the **Edit** button, then check the box
next to \"Open in a new window?\", and click on **Update Options**. This
will ensure that your web content tool opens properly in a new window,
and is not blocked from opening within the Isidore window.\'\'

## Editing a Web Content Item {#editing_a_web_content_item}

To edit a web content item:

1.  Navigate to the **Web Content** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Near the top right-hand corner of the Web Content frame, click on
    **Edit** (pencil icon).
3.  On the \"Customize Web Content\" form, you can change the the
    following:
    -   Tool Title: The title that appears at the top of the Web Content
        frame
    -   Page Title: The title that appears in your site\'s menubar
    -   Frame Height: The height (in pixels) of the Web Content frame
    -   URL: The URL for the Web Content item
4.  To make your Web Content item open in a new browser window, check
    the box next to Open in a new window?. Additionally, you may choose
    to launch the window in its maximum width by checking the \"launch
    maximum width\" box.
5.  When you\'re finished, click **Update Options** to save your
    changes.

## Deleting a Web Content Item {#deleting_a_web_content_item}

To remove a web content item:

1.  In the relevant course or project site, click **Site Info**.
2.  Click the **Add / Remove Tools** button.
3.  From the list of tools, uncheck the item you wish to delete, and
    then click **Continue**.
4.  Review your information, and then click **Finish** to delete the
    item.

## Adding a Web Link {#adding_a_web_link}

To add a Resources item that is a URL to a web site:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Next to the folder to which you want to add the URL, click on
    **Actions**, and click **Add Web Links (URLs)**.
3.  For each resource, type the URL in the box. (You may omit the
    <http://> prefix.)
4.  Add a title for your URL link resource. If you don\'t add a title,
    the URL will be used as the title of the resource.
5.  To add another URL, click Add Another Web Link.\<br /\>*Note: To
    remove a URL from the list of URLs to add, click the red **X** next
    to it.*
6.  Click **Add Web Links Now** to finish.

## Editing a Web Link {#editing_a_web_link}

To edit a web link:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the web link you want to
    edit.
3.  Click on **Edit Details**.
4.  Make your changes.
5.  Click **Update**.

## Deleting a Web Link {#deleting_a_web_link}

To edit a web link:

1.  Navigate to the **Resources** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on the **Actions** button next to the web link you want to
    remove.
3.  Click **Move to Trash**.
4.  Click **Remove**.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Resources](Resources "wikilink")

To add an entry to your blog:

1.  Navigate to the **Blogs** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on **Add blog entry**.
3.  Enter a title for your blog post.
4.  Enter the text of your blog post in the provided text box.
5.  By default, your blog post will be publicly viewable, so anyone with
    the link could access it. If you wish for only you and the
    instructor and teaching assistants to view your blog post, select
    the \"Only site administrator and I can see this entry\" option. If
    you wish for all class participants, but not the public, to be able
    to access your blog post, select the \"All members of this site can
    see this entry\" option.
6.  Click on **Publish entry** to make your blog post available to
    others. You can also click on **Save Draft** if you want to come
    back in to edit your blog post and publish it later.

## Editing a Blog Entry {#editing_a_blog_entry}

To edit a blog entry you made, or to change who can see it:

1.  Navigate to the **Blogs** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on your name from the main blog page.
3.  Locate the entry you wish to edit.
4.  Click on **Edit entry**.
5.  Make the desired changes.
6.  Click on **Publish entry**.

## Removing a Blog Entry {#removing_a_blog_entry}

To remove a blog entry you made:

1.  Navigate to the **Blogs** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on your name from the main blog page.
3.  Locate the entry you wish to delete.
4.  Click on **Remove entry**.
5.  Click on **OK** to confirm removal.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Blogs](Blogs "wikilink") page

To add a new flashcard set:

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool wherever you have added it.
2.  Click on the **Create Card Set** button.
3.  Enter a title for the card set.
4.  Click the **Add Card Set** button.
5.  The new card set will be created, and you will be taken to the page
    where you can begin adding flashcards.

## Editing a Flashcard Set {#editing_a_flashcard_set}

To edit a flashcard set:

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool wherever you have added it.
2.  Locate the card set you would like to edit. Click on the
    **Settings** cog icon in the Options area for that card set.
3.  You may edit the card set\'s title and published/unpublished status
    on the **Settings** page.
4.  Click on **Update Flashcard Set** to save your changes. Click
    **Cancel** to discard your changes.

## Deleting a Flashcard Set {#deleting_a_flashcard_set}

To delete a flashcard set:

1.  Click on the **Flashcards** tool wherever you have added it.
2.  Locate the card set you would like to delete. Click on the
    **Settings** cog icon in the Options area for that card set.
3.  Click on **Delete** to delete the card set. Press **OK** to
    permanently delete the set. Press **Cancel** to keep the card set.
    **Please note** that card sets cannot be recovered once they are
    deleted.

To add a knowledge check:

1.  Navigate to a **Knowledge Check** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **Create Knowledge Check** link.
3.  Enter a title in the **Knowledge Check Title** text box and click on
    the **Add Knowledge Check** button.
4.  Click on the **Add New Question** button.
5.  Select whether you\'re creating a multiple choice or true/false
    question by clicking on the respective button.
6.  Enter a point value, question text, and answer choices. Click on the
    radio button next to the correct response. You may also add
    incorrect/correct feedback by clicking on the \"Add Feedback\"
    button.
7.  Click on the **Save** button.
8.  Repeat steps 4-7 to add more questions to the knowledge check.
9.  Once you\'ve added all of your questions, make sure that your
    knowledge check becomes available to students by clicking on the
    **Unpublished** (or checkmark) button on the main Knowledge Check
    page.

## Editing a Knowledge Check {#editing_a_knowledge_check}

To edit a knowledge check:

1.  Navigate to a **Knowledge Check** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the title of the knowledge check you would like to edit.
3.  Make your changes to the questions, using the **Edit** (pencil) to
    modify them or the **Delete** (trash can) to delete them.
4.  Click on the **Save** button to save your changes.

## Deleting a Knowledge Check {#deleting_a_knowledge_check}

To delete a knowledge check:

1.  Navigate to a **Knowledge Check** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **Settings** link.
3.  Click on the **Delete** button.
4.  Click on **OK** when the deletion warning appears. You can also
    locate the knowledge check link your Lessons tool and click on the
    trash can to the right of it.

To add a pre/post reflection:

1.  Click on the **Pre/Post Reflection** tool wherever you have added
    it.
2.  Click on the **Get Started** button.
3.  Click on the **pencil icon** next to the title of the Pre/Post
    Reflection to change the name of the activity.
4.  Type your initial question prompt into the **Pre-Question** text
    box.
5.  In the **Wait Time** text box, enter a time students must wait
    before answering the post question.
6.  Type your follow up question prompt into the **Post-Question** text
    box.
7.  Optional: Type your wrap-up question into the **Wrap-Up Question**
    text box.
8.  Click on the **Save** button.

## Editing a Pre/Post Reflection {#editing_a_prepost_reflection}

To edit a pre/post reflection:

1.  Click on the **Pre/Post** tool wherever you have added it.
    1.  Click on the pencil edit icon next to the title to edit the
        title of the activity.
    2.  Click on the pencil edit icon next to the Pre Question to edit
        the pre question.
    3.  Click on the pencil edit icon next to the Post Question to edit
        the post question.
    4.  Click on the pencil edit icon next to the Wrap Up Question to
        edit the wrap up question.
2.  Click on the **disk icon** to save your changes. Click on the **x**
    to cancel changes.

## Deleting a Pre/Post Reflection {#deleting_a_prepost_reflection}

To delete a pre/post reflection:

1.  Navigate to the location you added the pre/post reflection in
    Lessons.
2.  Click on the **trash can** to the right of it to delete it.
3.  Click on the **Delete** button to confirm deletion.

To add a Quick Poll:

1.  Click on the link of the Quick Poll instance you added to your site.
2.  There are two ways to add a poll.
    -   To add a new poll, click on **+ Add Active Poll**.
    -   To add a poll you\'ve previously used in the site, expand the
        **Poll Library** section and toggle the switch next to it to
        \"on\". This will make the previously used poll active.
3.  If you\'re adding a new poll, enter a question and some answer
    choices.
4.  Adjust the poll settings.
5.  Choose whether you want the poll to be active. Once it\'s active,
    students will be able to respond to it.
6.  Click on **Submit**.

## Editing a Quick Poll {#editing_a_quick_poll}

*Please note that a Quick Poll cannot be edited once students have
responded. In order to edit the poll, you\'ll need to clear the results,
which aren\'t recoverable. Once the results are cleared, you\'ll be able
to edit the poll.*

To edit a Quick Poll:

1.  Click on the link of the Quick Poll instance you added to your site.
2.  If the poll you would like to modify is active, click on the edit
    (pencil) icon. If the poll you would like to modify is inactive,
    click to expand the **Poll Library** and click on the edit (pencil)
    icon next to it.
    -   If students have already responded to the poll, you can\'t
        modify the poll unless you delete their responses. To do this,
        you\'ll need to click on **Reset All Responses** and then **OK**
        to confirm the reset.
3.  Make the desired changes.
4.  Click on **Submit**.

## Deleting a Quick Poll {#deleting_a_quick_poll}

*Please be aware that any data deleted from the Quick Poll learning app
is not recoverable. In order to delete the poll, you\'ll need to clear
the results, which aren\'t recoverable. Once the results are cleared,
you\'ll be able to delete the poll.*

To delete a Quick Poll:

1.  Click on the link of the Quick Poll instance you added to your site.
2.  If the poll you want to delete is the active poll, click on the edit
    (pencil) icon.
    -   If students have already responded to the poll, you can\'t
        delete the poll unless you delete their responses. To do this,
        you\'ll need to click on **Reset All Responses** and then **OK**
        to confirm the reset.
3.  Click on **Delete Poll**.
4.  Click on **OK** to confirm deletion.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Quick Poll](Quick_Poll "wikilink")

To add a Quick Write question:

1.  Navigate to a **Quick Write** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **Get Started** button.
3.  Click on the **Add Question** button.
4.  Type the question you would like students to answer into the text
    box.
5.  Press the **disk icon** to save the question.
6.  The question will appear in the list of questions and will be
    available to students to answer.

## Editing a Quick Write question {#editing_a_quick_write_question}

To edit a Quick Write question:

1.  Navigate to a **Quick Write** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **pencil icon** next to the question you would like to
    edit.
3.  Make your changes to the question text, then press the **disk icon**
    to save the changes.
    -   **Note:** Students who have already answered the question will
        not be able to edit their responses. Consider adding a new Quick
        Write question if students need to respond again.

## Deleting a Quick Write question {#deleting_a_quick_write_question}

To delete a Quick Write question:

1.  Navigate to a **Quick Write** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **trash can icon** next to the question you would like
    to delete.
3.  Click **OK** in the confirmation box to delete the question. Click
    **Cancel** to cancel.
