To add a rubric:

1.  Navigate to the **Rubrics** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **+ Add Rubric** button.
3.  Give the rubric a title and press **Save**.
4.  Set up the criterion. By default, you\'ll have \"Criterion 1\" and
    \"Criterion 2\".
    -   You can edit criterion titles by clicking on the edit icon
        (pencil in a box). You can also add a description of the
        criterion. Press **Save** to preserve your changes.
    -   You can re-order the criterion by clicking on the hamburger icon
        (3 horizontal lines) and dragging to the appropriate position.
    -   To add more criteria, you can either click on the copy icon
        (looks like 2 pieces of paper) next to each criteria, or you can
        click on the **+ Add Criterion** button to add one manually.
    -   To remove a criterion, click on the remove icon (X) next to the
        criterion.
    -   To copy a criterion, click on the \"copy criterion\" icon (two
        pieces of paper). Enter a Criterion Title and click on the
        **Save** button to preserve your changes.

## Editing a Rubric {#editing_a_rubric}

To edit a rubric:

1.  Navigate to the **Rubrics** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the title of the rubric to open it. *Please note that if
    there\'s a lock icon next to the rubric title, you will not be able
    to edit it. This indicates that the rubric has been associated with
    an assignment, assessment, or gradebook item and can\'t be edited.
    You can copy the rubric by clicking on the icon that looks like two
    pieces of paper if you would like to create a new copy of it.*
3.  Use the \"add\", \"edit\", \"reorder\", and \"remove\" icons to make
    desired changes to the rubric criterion and/or ratings. Some
    changes, like modifying criteria and ratings need to be saved by
    clicking on the **Save** button. Other changes, like reordering and
    removing criteria and ratings are saved automatically.
4.  The rubric will now be ready to be associated with an assignment,
    assessment question, or gradebook item.

## Deleting a Rubric {#deleting_a_rubric}

To delete a rubric:

1.  Navigate to the **Rubrics** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the **x** (remove) icon next to the rubric you wish to
    delete. *If there\'s not a remove icon next to the rubric and there
    is a lock icon next to the rubric title, the rubric has already been
    associated with an assignment, assessment, or gradebook item and
    cannot be removed.*
3.  Click on the **Remove** button to confirm deletion.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Rubrics](Rubrics "wikilink") page.

## Adding a section {#adding_a_section}

Sections may be used to split up content. For example, you may wish to
have a section for your course syllabus, team assignments, and course
schedule. By default, there is a **Syllabus** section in the Syllabus
tool. You may add an attachment file or you can edit the title of the
section and add content to it. You may also remove the default section
if you don\'t wish to use it.

To add a section:

1.  Navigate to the **Syllabus** tool in your course site.
2.  Click on **Add Section**.
3.  Enter a **Title** for the section.
4.  Enter (or paste) content into the **Content** section.
5.  Click on **Add and Publish**.

Note: You cannot add an attachment to the section until you save it.
Once you save the section and expand it, the **Add attachments** button
will appear.

## Adding a syllabus attachment {#adding_a_syllabus_attachment}

To add a syllabus attachment, you must first add a section. There is a
default **Syllabus** section in an empty Syllabus tool.

1.  Navigate to the **Syllabus** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the section you wish to add an attachment to.
3.  Click on **Add attachments**.
4.  Click on **Browse** to upload a file from your computer, or click on
    **Attach a copy** next to a file that is already in your course
    Resources folder.
    1.  If you chose the option to \"browse\" for a file on your
        computer, navigate to where the file is located, select it, and
        click on **Open**.
5.  Click on **Continue**.
6.  The file(s) you selected should now be attached to the syllabus
    section.

## Editing a section {#editing_a_section}

To edit a section:

1.  Navigate to the **Syllabus** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the section you wish to edit.
3.  Click on the edit (pencil) icon.
4.  Make the desired changes to the title, content, or attachments.
5.  Click on **Add and Publish**.

## Deleting a section {#deleting_a_section}

To delete a section:

1.  Navigate to the **Syllabus** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the section you wish to delete.
3.  Click on the delete (trash can) icon.
4.  Click on **Delete** to confirm removal.

## Deleting a syllabus attachment {#deleting_a_syllabus_attachment}

To delete a syllabus attachment:

1.  Navigate to the **Syllabus** tool in your course site.
2.  Locate the section that contains the syllabus item you wish to
    delete. You may need to expand the section by clicking on it if
    it\'s collapsed.
3.  Click on the delete (trash can) icon next to the attachment file you
    wish to delete.
4.  Click on **Delete** to confirm removal.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Syllabus](Syllabus "wikilink") page

## Adding a Study Question {#adding_a_study_question}

To add a study question:

1.  Navigate to an instance of a study question on a Lessons page or
    subpage and click on the link.
2.  If your instructor has made it so you cannot see questions before
    posting your own, a form to add a study question will appear. Enter
    the text of the question. Enter the text of the answer. Click on
    **Save**. Alternatively, if your instructor has allowed you to see
    questions before posting your own, click on **+ Add Question**,
    enter a question and answer, and click on **Save**.
3.  Your question will be added to the question list.

## Editing a Study Question {#editing_a_study_question}

To edit a study question:

1.  Navigate to an instance of a study question on a Lessons page or
    subpage and click on the link.
2.  Click on the edit (pencil) icon.
3.  Make the desired edits and click on **Save**.

## Deleting a Study Question {#deleting_a_study_question}

*Please use caution with removing questions from Study Questions tool.
Data is not recoverable once it\'s deleted.*

To delete a study question:

1.  Navigate to an instance of a study question on a Lessons page or
    subpage and click on the link.
2.  Click on the delete (trash can) icon.
3.  Click on **OK** to confirm deletion.

To add an announcement:

1.  Navigate to the **Announcements** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Add**.
3.  In the text box next to \"Announcement title\", type the subject of
    your announcement.
4.  In the text box under \"Body\", use the [rich-text
    editor](rich-text_editor "wikilink") to create and format the body
    of your announcement. \<br /\> **Note**: Pasting text into the
    [rich-text editor](rich-text_editor "wikilink") should preserve most
    formatting, but some types of formatting, such as colored text, may
    need to be added manually in the editor after pasting.
5.  Under \"Access\", select how to display your announcement:
    -   **Only members of this site can see this announcement:** the
        announcement would be viewable by all site participants.
    -   **This announcement is publicly viewable:** the announcement
        would be viewable by anyone visiting the site in the Site
        Browser.
    -   **Displays this announcement to selected groups only:** the
        announcement is visible only to the sections or groups you
        specify. Use the checkboxes to choose which groups or sections
        can view the announcement. \<br /\>**Note**: If you don\'t see
        the **Displays this announcement to selected groups only**
        option, no groups or sections are associated with your site; see
        [Manage Groups](Manage_Groups "wikilink").
6.  Under \"Availability\", select **Show** to release your announcement
    or **Hide** to hide it, or select **Specify Dates**, and then select
    a beginning date and/or ending date for the announcement\'s
    visibility. \<br /\>Note: If you choose to specify dates, any email
    notifications will be sent out on the specified beginning date.
7.  Under \"Attachments\", you can attach a file from your local
    computer or from Resources, or specify the URL for a file on the
    web.
8.  You can choose to have your announcement emailed to participants in
    addition to being posted. From the **Email Notification** section,
    select the appropriate option:
    -   **High - All participants** (the default setting)
    -   **Low - Not received by those who have opted out**
    -   **None - No notification**
9.  To post your announcement, click **Post Announcement**.

## Editing an announcement {#editing_an_announcement}

To edit an announcement:

1.  Navigate to the **Announcements** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Under the announcement\'s subject, click **Edit**.\<br /\>*Note: If
    you don\'t have sufficient rights to edit a particular announcement,
    you will not see the option to revise it.*
3.  Make the desired changes to your announcement.
4.  Click on **Save Changes** to update the announcement with your
    changes. Click on **Preview** to make sure your changes look okay
    before clicking on **Save Changes**.

## Deleting an announcement {#deleting_an_announcement}

To delete one or more announcements:

1.  Navigate to the **Announcements** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Under \"Remove?\", select the announcement(s) you want to delete (by
    checking the box).\<br /\>*Note: If you don\'t have sufficient
    rights to delete a particular announcement, you will not see a box
    next to its title.*
3.  Click **Update**.
4.  On the confirmation screen, click **Remove**.

# Adding an Assignment {#adding_an_assignment}

To add an assignment:

1.  Navigate to the **Assignments** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on **Add**.
3.  Fill in the assignment title and instructions.
4.  If you would like students to acknowledge the honor pledge before
    submitting their work, check the box next to \"Add honor pledge\".
5.  If you would like to add attachments to the assignment that contains
    instructions or a template to complete the assignment, click on the
    **Add Attachments** button, browse to where the files are located,
    and upload the files.
6.  Set the open date, due date, and accept until date by clicking on
    the calendar and selecting a date. Once a date is selected, adjust
    the time by either using the slider or the minus and plus icons. The
    open date is when students will be able to see the assignment and
    begin submitting it. The accept until date is a date that students
    won\'t see, but allows them to submit their assignments late.
    Assignments submitted after the due date will be flagged as late.
7.  Set advanced date options, such as hiding the due date from students
    (not recommended), adding the due date to the calendar (only shown
    if the Calendar tool is installed), and/or adding an announcement
    about the open date to announcements (only shown if the
    Announcements tool is installed). If you enable the announcements
    option, you\'ll be able to choose whether to send an email
    notification about the open date to all participants.
8.  Submission type refers to the format of the student\'s submitted
    assignment.
    -   \"Attachments only\" is the most common type, where students can
        upload file attachment(s) for the instructor to review. Students
        may upload up to 5 file attachments per assignment. (Limit of
        250 MB)
    -   \"Inline\" means that students type or paste their assignment
        into a text box for the instructor to review.
    -   \"Inline and Attachments\" means that students can choose
        whether to upload a file attachment or type or paste their
        assignment into a text box. (Limit of 250 MB)
    -   \"Non-electronic\" is used to provide assignment instructions,
        but students aren\'t expected to submit anything electronically.
        One use case might be bringing an article to class. Single file
        upload works just like the attachments type, but restricts the
        number of files students can upload to one.
    -   \"Single Uploaded file only\" means that students can only
        upload one file attachment for the instructor to review. (Limit
        of 250 MB)
    -   \"External Tool (LTI)\" means that you\'re linking an assignment
        to an outside system that supports [Learning Tools
        Interoperability
        (LTI)](https://www.imsglobal.org/activity/learning-tools-interoperability).
        No files will be submitted in Isidore, but you can still enter a
        grade and feedback comments for students.
9.  In the \"Assign To\" section, the settings allow you to select
    different options, such as individual assignments or group
    assignments.
    -   Assigning an assignment to each individual member of the site is
        the most frequently used option. This means that each student
        will submit their own assignment.
    -   Assigning an assignment to each individual member of the
        selected group(s) is used if you only want to assign an
        assignment to a specific group or section of students. Each
        student in the group or section will submit their own
        assignment.
    -   Assigning an assignment to the selected group(s), as a group
        assignment (one group member submits on behalf of the entire
        group) means that students are working in teams and only one
        student within that team will submit an assignment on behalf of
        the group. *Please note that groups should be setup and
        \"finalized\" in Site Info \> Manage Groups prior to setting up
        the assignment. Once the assignment is posted, the groups will
        be locked and will not be able to be edited.*
10. If you would like students to be able to resubmit their assignment
    prior to the due date, you can enable the \"Allow Resubmission\"
    option. Once enabled, enter the number of resubmissions students are
    allowed to have and when those resubmissions should be due (usually
    the due date or before).
11. If you would like to have student papers run through Turnitin (UD\'s
    plagiarism detection software), check the box next to \"Use
    Turnitin\". By default students are allowed to see their originality
    reports (recommended), but you can uncheck that option.
12. If you would like to grade anonymously, you can check the box next
    to \"Hide submitters\' identities (e.g. for anonymous grading)\".
    When grading, students\' names will be replaced with an alphanumeric
    code. This setting can be toggled back on at any time. Please note
    that if students include their name within their file attachment or
    the filename, you\'ll be able to see their identities.
13. The default setting is that assignments are set to be graded, but
    this can be turned off my unchecking the \"Grade this assignment\"
    box.
    -   If you\'re setting up a graded assignment, select a grading
        scale. Please note that \"Points\" is the only grading scale
        that works with Gradebook.
    -   Specify the maximum number of points.
    -   Enable rubric grading if you wish to use a rubric. For more
        assistance with rubric grading, please visit the
        [Rubrics](Rubrics "wikilink") page for step-by-step
        instructions.
    -   If you would like the assignment grades to be sent to the
        Gradebook, check the box to enable the setting. This setting
        only appears if you have the Gradebook tool installed.
    -   If you would like to setup peer review, check the box next to
        \"Use peer assessment\" and adjust the other settings. Please
        note that the start date for the peer review period is set to
        the assignment\'s accept until date. Please review our
        instructions to [Setup peer
        review](Setup_peer_review "wikilink").
14. Notification email options and additional information sections are
    expandable if you would like to adjust the notification settings and
    add items like a model answer.
15. Click on **Post** to save your assignment settings and make the
    assignment available to students at the specified open date and
    time.

# Editing an Assignment {#editing_an_assignment}

To edit a draft or posted assignment:

1.  Navigate to the **Assignments** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  You will see a list of assignments.
3.  Under the assignment title you wish to modify, click **Edit**
4.  Make your revisions to the assignment settings.
5.  After you have made your revisions, you can click **Post**. If the
    page refreshes and the assignment doesn\'t post, check the screen
    for errors. You may need to click on **Post** again or fix some
    settings before the system will let you post it.

# Deleting an Assignment {#deleting_an_assignment}

To delete an assignment:

1.  Navigate to the **Assignments** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  You will see a list of assignments.
3.  Under the **Remove?** column label, check the box next to the
    assignment you want to delete.
4.  Click **Remove Selected** at the bottom of the page.
5.  On the confirmation screen, click **Delete** to permanently delete
    the assignment.

To add an emoji rating scale:

1.  Click on the **Emoji Ratings** tool where you have added it.
2.  Click on the **Get Started** button.
3.  Select the **Use This Scale** button next to the scale you wish to
    use.
    -   The Feeling scale can be used to measure how the students are
        feeling.
    -   The Confidence scale can be used to measure how confident
        students are about what they have learned.
4.  Type the prompt to which you\'d like the students to respond in the
    **Prompt** text box.
5.  Click on the **Save** button.
6.  The emoji scale will appear wherever you placed it.

## Editing an Emoji Rating Scale {#editing_an_emoji_rating_scale}

To edit an emoji rating scale:

1.  Click on the **Emoji Ratings** tool where you have added it.
2.  Click on the **Edit** button.
3.  Select the **Use This Scale** button next to the scale you wish to
    use.
4.  Edit the prompt to which you\'d like the students to respond.
5.  Click on the **Save** button.
6.  The emoji rating will be updated.

## Deleting an Emoji Rating Scale {#deleting_an_emoji_rating_scale}

To delete an emoji rating scale:

1.  Navigate to where the Emoji Ratings tool is installed in Lessons.
2.  Click on the trashcan to the right of the item.
3.  Click on the **Delete** button to confirm deletion.

`     ``<text bytes="3432" sha1="np8vyoqx42qx5upf8eucbpv8nq2n3vd" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`== Adding an Interactive Video ==`

To add an interactive video:

1.  Click on the **Interactive Video** tool wherever you have added it.
    To learn how to add learning apps, see [How to Install Learning Apps
    in Lessons](How_to_Install_Learning_Apps_in_Lessons "wikilink").
2.  Provide a title for your video in the **Video Title** field.
3.  Select the **Warpwire Video** tab if you\'d like to use a Warpwire
    video. Select the **YouTube** tab if you\'d like to use a YouTube
    video.
    -   NOTE: If you are are using a Warpwire Video, you can click on
        the **Launch Video Picker** button to select the video from your
        Warpwire Video library. This button will open a popup with a
        list of all your Warpwire Video libraries. Click on the library
        that contains the video you\'d like to add, then click on the
        circle next to the video and press insert.
    -   NOTE: We **highly recommend** setting the Warpwire Video to be
        shared as **public** so that students don\'t have to
        authenticate in order to see the video. See [Share a
        video](Share_a_video "wikilink") to change the sharing settings
        on the video.
    -   NOTE: If you are using a YouTube Video, you\'ll want to copy the
        URL from your browser\'s address bar instead of the URL copied
        from the \"Share\" link.
4.  Add the web address of the video in the **Video URL** field and
    click on **Create**.
5.  You will be taken to the **Build Mode** page.
6.  Click on the **Add Question** button to get started. You can select
    from different question types including: multiple choice, short
    answer, info card, and multiple choice survey.
7.  In the **Video Time** boxes, enter the number of hours, minutes, and
    seconds in the video where you would like the question to pop up.
8.  Depending on which question type you\'re adding, complete the
    question form that may include question text, possible answers, and
    card text.
    -   In multiple choice question types, clicking the checkmark icon
        next to answer choices indicates that those are correct. *Please
        note that students must choose all of the correct answer choices
        in order to have the question marked as correct.* Additionally,
        you can randomize the answers by selecting the checkbox next to
        **Randomize Answers**.
9.  Click on the **Add Feedback** section if you\'d like to provide
    feedback for students to see after they respond to the questions.
10. Click **Save** to save the question. Click **Cancel** to cancel your
    changes.
11. Continue adding questions until you are finished.

## Editing an Interactive Video {#editing_an_interactive_video}

To edit an interactive video:

1.  Click on the **Interactive Video** tool wherever you have added it.
2.  To edit the video title, click on the pencil icon in the top right
    hand corner of the **Build Mode** page.
3.  To edit the individual questions, click on the question, then select
    the **Edit Question** option.
4.  Make the required edits, then press **Save.**

## Deleting an Interactive Video {#deleting_an_interactive_video}

To delete an interactive video:

1.  Click on the **Interactive Video** tool wherever you have added it.
2.  Click on the trash can icon in the top right hand corner.
3.  You will see a confirmation message warning you that you will be
    deleting the question, students\' responses, and all associated
    questions. This cannot be undone.
4.  Click **OK** to delete the video. Click **Cancel** to cancel the
    deletion.
5.  You will be taken to the page where you can add a new video web
    address to create a new interactive video.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Interactive
Video](Interactive_Video "wikilink") page `</text>`{=html}

## Adding/Editing a report {#addingediting_a_report}

-   Click on \"Reports\";
-   Click **Add** (or **Edit** below a report\'s title) to edit the
    report definition.
-   The report editing page will be presented. Configure the report
    accordingly to match your needs:

### Report

This option is collapsed by default. If you wish to save the report you
need to click the **Show** link to display additional options:

-   **Title**: The report\'s title.
-   **Description**: The report\'s description.

### What?

This option allows to configure the type of activity to report.

-   **Visits**: Site visits.
-   **Events**: Tool activity (activity can be selected by tool or by
    event).
-   **Resources**: Resource (file/folder) activity. This selection can
    be filtered by:
    -   **Action**: New (file uploaded/folder created), Read (file
        opened for reading), Revise (file details or contents changed)
        or Delete (file/folder deleted).
    -   **Resources**: Restricts report to selected files/folders or to
        files under selected folders.
-   **Presence Time**: User presence time in site.

### When?

This option allows to configure the time period to report.

-   **All**: All activity since site creation.
-   **Last 7 days**: Activity from the last 7 days.
-   **Last 30 days**: Activity from the last 30 days.
-   **Last 365 days**: Activity from the last 365 days.
-   **Custom**: Activity from a user-specified date interval.

### Who?

This option allows to configure the users to report.

-   **All**: All site users.
-   **Role**: Users with the a user-specified role.
-   **Group**: Users with the a user-specified group.
-   **Custom**: Users selected from the presented list. Multiple users
    can be selected pressing the CTRL (for disjoint selection) or ALT
    (for range selection) keys while clicking with the mouse.
-   **None**: To report users that doesn\'t match all the specified
    report conditions (e.g., selecting \"Visits\" + \"All\" date +
    \"None\" will report users that never visited the site).

### How?

This option allows to configure how the report will be presented.

-   **Totals by**: Defines how to group report data (eg, selecting
    \"User\" + \"Date\" will present a report grouped by user and date).
    Multiple fields can be selected pressing the CTRL (for disjoint
    selection) or ALT (for range selection) keys while clicking with the
    mouse.
-   **Number of results**: Allows to limit the number of report results.
-   **Presentation**: Defines how the report will be presented (table
    and/or chart).
-   **Chart type**: Defines the type of chart to be presented (bar, pie
    or timeseries (line or bar)).
-   **Chart data source/Chart series source**: Defines the main source
    of chart data. Only fields selected on Totals by will be selectable.
-   **Grouped by**: (Bar chart only) Defines the grouping field for
    chart data. Only fields selected on Totals by will be selectable.

## Duplicating a report {#duplicating_a_report}

Any report can be duplicated (reports defined by the user and predefined
reports):

-   Click on the tool Reports page;
-   Click **Duplicate** below a report\'s title; a copy from the related
    report will be created with the tile \"Copy of \[report title\]\"

## Deleting a report {#deleting_a_report}

-   Click on the tool Reports page;
-   Click **Delete** below a report\'s title; after confirming the
    report will be deleted.

## Adding Event {#adding_event}

To add a calendar event:

1.  Navigate to the **Calendar** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click **Add**.
3.  Enter the required information for title, date, and start time.
    Additionally, you can specify a duration or end time.
4.  Under \"Message\", use the HTML editor to create and format the body
    of your calendar event.
5.  To display the event to all members of the site, check **Display to
    site**. To display the event only to members of a certain group,
    check **Display to selected groups**, and then use the checkboxes to
    choose which groups or sections can view the calendar event.\<br
    /\>**Note**: If you don\'t see the **Display to selected groups**
    option, no groups or sections are associated with your site; see
    [Manage Groups](Manage_Groups "wikilink").
6.  If your event will take place more than once, you can set the
    frequency by clicking **Frequency**. Then:
    -   Next to \"Event Frequency\", use the drop-down list to select
        **daily**, **weekly**, **monthly**, or **yearly**.
    -   Next to \"Every:\", use the drop-down list to select a value
        between 1 and 31.
    -   Under \"Ends:\", use the radio buttons to select when you want
        your event to stop recurring.
    -   Click **Save Frequency**.\<br /\>**Note**: If you do not choose
        a frequency, your activity will occur once.
7.  Next to \"Event Type\", use the drop-down list to choose an
    appropriate classification for your event.
8.  Next to \"Event Location\", type a location for your event into the
    text box.
9.  Under \"Attachments\", you can attach a file from your local
    computer or from Resources, or specify the URL for a file on the
    web.
10. To save your event and post it to the calendar, click **Save
    Event**.

## Editing Events {#editing_events}

To edit an existing calendar event:

1.  Navigate to the **Calendar** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Find the event on your calendar and click its title.
3.  Click **Edit**.
4.  In the resulting form, make your desired changes.
5.  When you are finished editing the event, click **Save Event**.

## Removing Events {#removing_events}

To remove a calendar event:

1.  Navigate to the **Calendar** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Find the event on your calendar and click its title.
3.  Click **Remove event**. For recurring events, on the confirmation
    page, you can choose to **Delete all occurrences** or **Delete only
    this occurrence**. Click **Remove event** to remove the event.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to main [Calendar](Calendar "wikilink") page

## Adding a Category {#adding_a_category}

2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  In the **Manage Categories and Requirements** section, click the
    **Add Category** button.

    description of the category.

    -   **Note:** Click the **Show Rich Text Editor** link to add
        formatting to the description.
6.  Click the **Save Changes** button to save the category or the
    **Cancel** button to cancel.

## Editing a Category {#editing_a_category}

1.  Navigate to the **CompFolio** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  Click the gear icon next to the category you\'d like to edit.
5.  Click the **Edit Category** option from the popup.
6.  Make whatever changes necessary to the category title and
    description, then click the **Save Changes** button to save the
    category or the **Cancel** button to cancel.

## Removing a Category {#removing_a_category}

1.  Navigate to the **CompFolio** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  Click the gear icon next to the category you\'d like to remove.
5.  Click the **Delete Category** option from the popup. *Note: All
    requirements must be removed from the category before it can be
    deleted.*

## Adding a Requirement {#adding_a_requirement}

To add a requirement:

1.  Navigate to the **CompFolio** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  Click on the category to which you\'d like to add a requirement to
    expand it.
    -   **Note**: You must create a category before you can add a
        requirement.
5.  You will see a popup where you will be prompted for a name and
    description of the requirement.
    -   *Note: A requirement name is required.*
    -   *Note: Click the **Show Rich Text Editor** link to add
        formatting to the description.*
6.  Click the **Save Changes** button to save the requirement or the
    **Cancel** button to cancel.

## Editing a Requirement {#editing_a_requirement}

To edit a requirement:

1.  Navigate to the **CompFolio** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  Click on the category that includes the requirement you\'d like to
    edit.
5.  Click the gear icon next to the requirement you\'d like to edit.
6.  Click the **Edit Requirement** option from the popup.
7.  Make whatever changes necessary to the requirement title and
    description, then click the **Save Changes** button to save the
    requirement or the **Cancel** button to cancel.

## Removing a Requirement {#removing_a_requirement}

To remove a requirement:

1.  Navigate to the **CompFolio** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click the **Manage** button.
3.  Click the **Categories and Requirements** button.
4.  Click on the category that includes the requirement you\'d like to
    remove.
5.  Click the gear icon next to the requirement you\'d like to remove.
6.  Click the **Delete Requirement** option from the popup.
7.  Click the **OK** button to remove the requirement. Click the
    **Cancel** button to cancel.

*Note: Submissions to the requirements cannot be restored.* \<br /\>\<br

\_\_NOTOC\_\_ To create a new question pool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, click **Add New Pool**.
4.  Then, on the Add Pool screen:
    -   In the \"Pool Name\" field, give your question pool a name.\<br
        /\>**Note**: It\'s a good idea to give your pool a unique name.
        If you later create a random draw part, you\'ll select a
        question pool from a list of all the pools that you own or have
        been shared with you.
    -   In the optional \"Department/Group\" field, you may type a
        department or group name.
    -   In the optional \"Description\" field, you may type a
        description of the question pool.
    -   In the optional \"Objectives\" field, you may type a description
        of the objectives for this pool.
    -   In the optional \"Keywords\" field, you may type any keywords
        that may help you or someone else locate this question pool.
5.  When you\'re finished, click **Save** to return to the Question
    Pools screen.
6.  You may not see your new pool listed under \"Pool Name\" unless you
    click on **Assessments** then **Question Pools** again to refresh
    the page.

## Adding a subpool {#adding_a_subpool}

To create a subpool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, click the name of the pool in which
    you want to make a subpool.
4.  In the \"Subpools\" section, on the right, click **Add**.
5.  Complete the subpool fields just as you did in step 3 above, and
    then click **Save**.

You\'re now ready to add questions to this question pool or subpool; see
[Add Questions to Question
Pool](Add_Questions_to_Question_Pool "wikilink").

## Editing questions in a question pool {#editing_questions_in_a_question_pool}

To edit an existing question in a question pool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, select the pool that you wish to
    enter.
4.  On the next screen, you will see all the questions in the desired
    pool. Subpools will also be listed below. If you wish to edit any
    questions within a subpool, you must enter the subpool from this
    screen.
5.  Find the question you wish to edit, and click the question text.
6.  Make any desired changes to the question type, question text,
    attachments, question formatting, or any additional features of the
    question.
7.  When you\'re done, click **Save**.

## Moving a question pool or subpool {#moving_a_question_pool_or_subpool}

To move a question pool or subpool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, click **Move** below the title of your
    question pool. If subpools exist for a question pool, click the
    triangle next to its title to reveal them.
4.  On the Move Pool screen, use the radio buttons to select the
    destination pool or subpool. Choose **Question Pools TOP** to
    elevate a subpool to question pool status. If subpools exist for a
    question pool (or a subpool), click the triangle next to its title
    to reveal them.
5.  Click **Move**. Unless you chose **Question Pools TOP** in the
    previous step, the original pool will become a subpool of the chosen
    destination pool.

## Copying a question pool or subpool {#copying_a_question_pool_or_subpool}

To copy a question pool or subpool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, click **Copy** below the title of your
    question pool. If subpools exist for a question pool (or a subpool),
    click the triangle next to its title to reveal them.
4.  On the Copy Pool screen, use the checkboxes to select the
    destination pool or subpool. Choose **Question Pools TOP** to
    elevate a subpool to question pool status. If subpools exist for a
    question pool (or a subpool), click the triangle next to its title
    to reveal them.
5.  Click **Copy**. Unless you chose **Question Pools TOP** in the
    previous step, the original pool will become a subpool of the chosen
    destination pool.

## Removing a question pool or subpool {#removing_a_question_pool_or_subpool}

To remove a question pool or subpool:

1.  On the menubar for the relevant site, click **Tests & Quizzes**.
2.  On the Assessments page, click **Question Pools**.
3.  On the Question Pools screen, under \"Remove?\", check the box for
    the pool or subpool you wish to remove. If subpools exist for a
    question pool (or a subpool), click the triangle next to its title
    to reveal them.\<br /\>**Note**: Removing a pool deletes all
    associated subpools and questions.
4.  Click **Update**.
5.  On the next screen, click **Remove** to confirm.

To add or remove tools from your site:

1.  Navigate to the **Site Info** tool in your course site.
2.  Click **Add / Remove Tools**.
3.  The most commonly used tools are located in the **Core Tools**
    section. Additional tools are located in the **Learning Apps** and
    the **Supplementary Tools** section. Tools provided by outside
    organizations (textbook companies, other schools, etc.) are located
    in the **External Tools** section.
4.  To add a tool, check the box next to the appropriate tool name.
5.  Click **Continue**.
    -   If you\'ve selected tools that can have more than one instance
        (Lessons, News, or Web Content), you may be asked for some
        additional information at this point. Click **Continue** once
        you\'ve entered the appropriate information.
6.  On the confirmation screen, you will see a list of your site\'s
    tools and any changes you\'ve made. If the list is accurate, click
    **Finish**.

## Additional Options {#additional_options}

To enable MathJax or Lessons subpage navigation:

On the Add / Remove Tools page, there is an Additional Options section.
This section allows you to enable MathJax in your course site.
[MathJax](http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/mathjax.html) is an
open-source technology that displays mathematical equations.

This section also allows you to enable or disable lessons subpage
navigation. Enabling this option will display your Lessons subpages in
the left-hand course navigation menu. \<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the
main [Site Info](Site_Info "wikilink") page `</text>`{=html}

To add a roster to your site:

1.  Navigate to the **Site Info** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on **Edit Class Roster(s)**.
3.  Click on **Add Roster(s)**.
4.  Select the roster(s) you wish to add.
    -   If the roster you want to add is not displayed on the screen,
        click on the **I\'m unable to find my course or section\...**.
    -   Use the drop-down menus to select the **Subject**, **Course**,
        and **Section**.
    -   Click on **Continue**.
    -   If you are not currently listed as the instructor of record for
        a course, an email will be sent to the Center for Online
        Learning to authorize access to the roster. The roster will say
        \"Requested\" next to it until the Center for Online Learning
        approves it.
5.  Click **Continue**, and then on the next page, review the
    information, and click **Add Class(es)** to add the roster.

2.  Click on **Edit Class Roster(s)**.
3.  Check the **Remove** box next to the roster you want to remove.
4.  Click **Update**.

To add a sign-up sheet:

1.  Enter the Sign-up tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on **Add**.
    -   Enter a title for the sign-up (i.e. Review Session 1).
    -   Enter a location.
    -   Optional: enter a category for the session (i.e. Living
        Organisms).
    -   Optional: enter a description or instructions for students,
        explaining the sign-up process.
    -   Enter a start time for the session (this would be when the
        earliest time-slot begins).
    -   Enter an end time for the session (this would be when the last
        time-slot ends).
    -   Set a meeting frequency (if the event will repeat daily, weekly,
        or monthly).
    -   Set a time that the sign-up begins (earliest time you want
        students to be able to sign up).
    -   Set a time that the sign-up ends (latest time you want students
        to be able to sign up).
    -   Choose whether attendance will be taken. Attendance is a simple
        check box that is used to track whether a student attended a
        session or not.
    -   Choose who you would like to make the session sign-up available
        to. This can be everyone (the default), specific groups,
        specific rosters, or even other Isidore sites that have the
        Sign-up tool installed.
    -   Choose whether you want the meeting to be an open meeting where
        no sign-up is required, a single time-slot, or multiple slots.
        If you\'re choosing multiple slots, choose how many time slots
        are available for sign-up, and how many students can sign up for
        a particular time slot. The estimated duration of each time slot
        will be automatically calculated, based on the settings you
        specified.
3.  Click on the **Next** button.
    -   When the page loads, verify that your meeting summary looks
        okay.
    -   Under \"Display Participant Names\", choose whether you would
        like students to be able to see who\'s signed up for time-slots.
    -   Under \"Notifications of participant actions\", choose whether
        you want to be notified when students sign up or cancel
        appointments.
    -   Under \"Announce Availability\", choose whether you would like
        students to be notified of the availability of the sign-up. If
        you do, select \"All potential participants\".
4.  Click on **Publish** if you would like your students to sign-up for
    time-slots on their own or select **Assign Participants & Publish**
    if you want to assign students to a time-slot.
5.  The sign-up should appear once the page reloads.

## Editing a sign-up sheet {#editing_a_sign_up_sheet}

To edit a sign-up sheet:

1.  Enter the Sign-up tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Click on the meeting title.
3.  Click on **Modify**.
4.  Make your desired changes.
5.  Click on **Publish Modification**.

## Removing a sign-up sheet {#removing_a_sign_up_sheet}

To remove a sign-up sheet:

1.  Enter the Sign-up tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Check the box in the \"Remove\" column next to the meeting you\'re
    wanting to remove.
3.  Click on the **Remove Meetings** button. Click on **OK** on the
    pop-up warning.
4.  The meeting should be removed from the Sign-up tool.

\<br /\>\<br /\> Return to the main [Sign-up](Sign-up "wikilink") page

## Add a Checklist {#add_a_checklist}

To add a checklist:

1.  From your Lessons tool, click on **Add Content** and select **Add
    Checklist** under the \"Advanced Content Items\" heading. .
2.  Enter a title for the checklist (i.e. Module 1 Checklist).
3.  Choose whether to hide the checklist title from students.
4.  Enter a description for the checklist (i.e. Items that need to be
    completed during Module 1).
5.  Click on **Add New Checklist Item**.
6.  Enter text for the checklist item (i.e. Read Chapter 1 in Textbook).
7.  Continue adding checklist items.
8.  Click on **Save**.

## Edit a Checklist {#edit_a_checklist}

To edit a checklist:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (settings cog icon) to the right of the checklist.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Save** at the
    bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to your
    page without applying any changes.

## Add Linked Checklist Items {#add_linked_checklist_items}

Linked checklist items are items that will be automatically checked off
by the system once a student completes the task. Students cannot
manually check off these items themselves. To add a linked checklist
item:

1.  Make an item in Lessons required. For more information on how to
    require an item in Lessons.
2.  Click **Edit** (settings cog icon) to the right of the checklist.
3.  Click the **Link** icon to the right of the task you\'d like to make
    linked.
4.  In the **Edit external link** popup, select the item in Lessons
    which you\'d like to link to this task.
    -   **Note:** An item from this list can be linked to only one task
        in the Checklist.
5.  Click **Submit.**
6.  Click **Save.**
7.  When you hover over the linked checklist item in Lessons, you will
    see that it cannot be manually checked off. There will also be a
    popup indicating which item it is linked to.

## Remove a Checklist {#remove_a_checklist}

To remove a checklist:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the
    checklist.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## View Checklist Progress {#view_checklist_progress}

To view students\' checklist progress:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **View Checklist Progress** (bulleted list icon) to the right
    of the checklist.

A Comments Tool permits students to make comments. Once a student has
added a comment, they may change or delete it for 30 minutes. After
that, only an instructor may change or delete it.

## Add a Comments Tool {#add_a_comments_tool}

To add a comments tool:

1.  Navigate to your Lessons tool.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add Comments Tool** under the
    \"Advanced Content Items\" heading.
3.  Instructors and students can add their comments immediately by
    clicking on the **Add Comment** button.

## Edit a Comments Tool {#edit_a_comments_tool}

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the comments
    tool. The Edit button will allow you to change certain details about
    the comment tool. This includes the following:
    -   **Keep Comments Anonymous** - The author will be shown as
        Anonymous followed by a number, except that instructors will
        still be able to see the real author. The number is used so that
        students can see which comments were added by the same person.
        If there are several comments blocks, the numbers are not
        consistent across the blocks.
    -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are Completed** -
        Select this option if you would like comments tobe accessible
        only after previously \'Required\' items have been
        completed/accessed.
    -   **Require This Item** - Select this option to make this item a
        \'Required\' item for later on in the Lessons plan. The
        requirement will be satified once someone has added a comment.
    -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If you
        have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make the
        comments block visible only to some groups. Students who are not
        in one of the checked sections of groups will not see this item
        on their page at all.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Save** at the
    bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to your
    page without applying any changes.

## Remove a Comments Tool {#remove_a_comments_tool}

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the
    comments tool.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Grading Comments {#grading_comments}

To grade comments:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Show Grading Pane for Comments** (bulleted list icon) to the
    right of the comments tool.
3.  Enter students\' scores.
4.  Click on **Update points**.

## Add a Resource {#add_a_resource}

To add a resource:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add File or URL** under the
    \"Simple Content Items\" heading.
3.  Enter a name for the file or URL.
    -   To upload a file on your computer, click on **Choose Files** or
        **Browse** under \"Upload new file\".
    -   To add a file or URL that is in Resources, click on **Select
        existing files from Resources** and then **Select Resource(s)**.
    -   To add a file or URL from the Internet, click on the **Add new
        URL (web link)** and paste or type the web link into the \"Add a
        URL\" box.
4.  Click on **Save**.

## Edit a Resource {#edit_a_resource}

To edit a resource:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click on **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the
    resource you would like to modify.
3.  This will open up an *Edit Item* box on your screen. The options
    available for modification are as follows:
    -   Under \"Display Settings\":
        -   **Item Name** - Change the name of the text on the link to
            your resource on the main Lessons page.
        -   **Item Description** - Change/add a description to your
            resource, which will appear beneath the link to the
            resource.
        -   **Change File or URL** - Change the file being linked to, or
            the URL if you\'re using a Web Link.
    -   Under \"Layout & Style\":
        -   **Indent level** - Change how much the item is indented or
            outdented.
        -   **Custom CSS class** - Use your own custom css file for
            styling (advanced users only).
    -   Under \"Prerequisites & Requirements:
        -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are
            Completed** - Select this option if you would like it to
            appear/be accessible only after previously \'Required\'
            items have been completed/accessed.
    -   **Require This Item** - Select this option to make this item a
        \'Required\' item for later on in the Lessons plan. Students
        must complete this item before moving on.
    -   Under \"Visibility & Access\":
    -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If you
        have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make this
        item visible only to some groups. Students who are not in one of
        the checked sections of groups will not see this item on their
        page at all.
4.  To save your changes, click **Update Item**.

## Delete a Resource {#delete_a_resource}

To delete a resource:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete** (trash can icon) to the right of the resource you
    would like to remove.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Adding Images {#adding_images}

To add an image:

1.  Navigate to the **Wiki** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Navigate to the wiki page you wish to edit.
3.  Click on **Edit**.
4.  Click on the **Insert Image** icon, which looks like a picture.
5.  Navigate to where the image is located and select it, or upload a
    new image to Resources.
6.  Once the image is selected, click on **Continue**.
7.  Click on **Save**.

## Adding Attachments {#adding_attachments}

1.  Navigate to the **Wiki** tool in your Isidore course site.
2.  Navigate to the wiki page you wish to edit.
3.  Click on **Edit**.
4.  Click on the **Insert Link to Resource** icon, which looks like a
    file with a chain link.
5.  Navigate to where the file is located and select it, or upload a new
    image to Resources.
6.  Once the image is selected, click on **Continue**.
7.  Click on **Save**.

## Adding Items from the Current Site {#adding_items_from_the_current_site}

To add items from another Lessons page in the current site:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page in your course site where you wish to
    add content.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add items from another page**
    under \"Simple Content Items\".
3.  Make sure that the \"Select a Site\" drop-down is set to the current
    site and click on **Load pages from this site**.
4.  Click on the radio button next to the page that contains the items
    you\'re wanting to add.
5.  Click on **Use selected item**.
6.  The \"Reorder Page Items\" screen will appear. Items from both the
    current page will appear at the top. Items from the page you\'re
    copying from will be at the bottom and will have a double
    right-facing arrow (\>\>) next to them and are shaded yellow. You
    can click on the trash can icon next to any items you don\'t want
    added to the page. You can also drag items around on the page to
    reorder them.
7.  Click on the **Save** button to save the changes. You can click on
    **Cancel** if you think you\'ve made a mistake, and can then start
    over.

## Adding Items from Another Site {#adding_items_from_another_site}

*Please note that only Lessons items can be added from other sites
(text, images, videos, files, subpages, checklists, questions, comments,
and student content). If you need to add assignments, tests & quizzes,
and discussion forums to your site, you can use the [Import from
Site](Import_from_Site "wikilink") feature, then add them to Lessons.*

To add Lessons items from another site:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page in your course site where you wish to
    add content.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add items from another page**
    under \"Simple Content Items\".
3.  Make sure that the \"Select a Site\" drop-down is set to the site
    you want to add Lessons items from and click on **Load pages from
    this site**.
4.  Click on the radio button next to the page that contains the items
    you\'re wanting to add.
5.  Click on **Use selected item**.
6.  The \"Reorder Page Items\" screen will appear. Items from both the
    current page will appear at the top. Items from the page you\'re
    copying from will be at the bottom and will have a double
    right-facing arrow (\>\>) next to them and are shaded yellow. You
    can click on the trash can icon next to any items you don\'t want
    added to the page. You can also drag items around on the page to
    reorder them.
7.  Click on the **Save** button to save the changes. You can click on
    **Cancel** if you think you\'ve made a mistake, and can then start
    over.

-   Add Section Layout - This function allows you to quickly add various
    column and section structures to your Lessons page, as well as add
    styling to the column and section headers. These sections can help
    break up your content into meaningful themes or topics.
-   Add Page Layout - This function allows you to quickly create a list
    of Lessons subpages or a weekly module page. Everything will be
    formatted for you, you\'ll just need to customize the content.

## Add Section Layout {#add_section_layout}

To add a section layout to the page:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click on the **Add Layout** button.
3.  You\'ll be on the **Section Layouts** tab.
4.  From the Add Layout popup, you will have the ability to select
    several options: Section Title, Color Scheme, Layout, and Additional
    Options.
    -   **Note:** All of these options can be changed once you have
        created the layout.
    -   In the **Section Title** box, you can either add a section title
        or not. If you do not add a Section Title, you will not be able
        to make the section collapsible in the **Additional Options**
        area. Without a section title, the color you choose in the
        **Color Scheme** dropdown also will not apply to the section
        header.
    -   In the **Color Scheme** dropdown, choose from the list of colors
        to see a preview of how they will appear in the **Select
        Layout** area.
    -   In the **Select Layout** area, choose whatever column structure
        makes most sense for your content.
    -   In the **Additional Options** area, you can choose to make the
        section collapsible. If it is collapsible, you can choose if the
        section should start collapsed when the page first loads. If you
        have not added a title to the **Section Title** field, these
        options are disabled. You can also choose whether or not borders
        should exist for your columns in this section.
5.  Press the **Add Layout** button to add the layout to the bottom of
    your Lessons page. Press **Cancel** to cancel these changes.

The sesction layout will be added to the bottom of the page.

## Add Page Layout {#add_page_layout}

To add a page layout to the page:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click on the **Add Layout** button
3.  Click on the **Page Layouts** tab.
4.  Select from the page layout options. *Descriptions and a preview
    image are available when you select an option.*
5.  Complete the form by entering information or selecting options. *The
    options vary, depending on the type of layout.*
6.  Once you\'re ready, click on **Add Layout**. Press **Cancel** to
    cancel these changes.

The page layout will be added to the bottom of the page. \<br /\>\<br

## Add a Question {#add_a_question}

To add one question for students to answer:

1.  From your Lessons tool, click on **Add Content** and select **Add
    Question** under the \"Advanced Content Items\" heading.
2.  Choose whether your question is multiple choice or short answer.
3.  Adding a multiple choice question:
    -   Enter some question text.
    -   Enter the correct answer (make sure you check the box next to
        the correct answer(s)) and answer choices.
    -   Choose whether to show students a graph of student responses.
    -   Choose whether the question is graded.
    -   If the question is graded, enter a name for the gradebook column
        and how many points it\'s worth.
    -   Enter text to be displayed if the student answers correctly.
    -   Enter text to be displayed if the student answers incorrectly.
4.  Adding a short answer question:
    -   Enter some question text.
    -   Enter one or more possible answer choices.
    -   Choose whether the question is graded.
    -   If the question is graded, enter a name for the gradebook column
        and how many points it\'s worth.
    -   Enter text to be displayed if the student answers correctly.
    -   Enter text to be displayed if the student answers incorrectly.
5.  Click on **Save**.

## Edit a Question {#edit_a_question}

To edit a question:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the question.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Update Item** at
    the bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to
    your page without applying any changes.

## Remove a Question {#remove_a_question}

To remove a question:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the
    question.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Grade a Question {#grade_a_question}

To grade a question:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Click **Show Grading Pane** (bulleted list icon) to the right of the
    question.
3.  View or enter a student\'s grade.
4.  Click on **Update Points**.

## Add section breaks {#add_section_breaks}

Adding a section break allows you to insert a vertical break between
Lessons content. In other words, one section of content will be stacked
on top of another section of content.

**Note:** You must have already added some content to the page to add a
section break.

To add a section break:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Find the location on the page where you\'d like to add a new section
    break.
3.  Click on the **plus** icon adjacent to the item where you\'d like to
    add the section break. *Note: Hover over the \'plus\' icon to read
    its instructions before proceeding. Some plus icons add items above,
    while others at the bottom of existing sections add items below.*
4.  Choose the **Add section break** option from the Add Content menu
    that pops up.
5.  When the page refreshes, you will see an empty rectangular box that
    represents the new section.

## Add column breaks {#add_column_breaks}

Adding a column break allows you to insert a horizontal break between
Lessons content. In other words, one section of content will appear
side-by-side with another section of content.

**Note:** You must have already added some content to the page to add a
column break.

To add a column break:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  Find the location on the page where you\'d like to add a new column
    break.
3.  Click on the **plus** icon adjacent to the section where you\'d like
    to add the column break. *Note: Hover over the \'plus\' icon to read
    its instructions before proceeding. Some plus icons add items above,
    while others at the bottom of existing sections add items below.*
4.  Choose the **Add column break** option from the Add Content menu
    that pops up.
5.  When the page refreshes, you will see an empty rectangular box that
    represents the new column.

## Edit section/column settings {#edit_sectioncolumn_settings}

**Note:** You must have already added some content to the page to edit
the section/column settings.

To edit section/column settings:

1.  Navigate to the desired Lessons page.
2.  In the top left hand corner of the section, there is a **gear**
    (column settings) icon. Click on this icon to access section/column
    settings.
3.  In the section/column settings popup, there are a number of options:
    -   Double width: Choose this option to extend the width of a column
        when you have multiple columns in the same row.
    -   Two columns inside this one, text flows between them: Choose
        this option to add an internal column break within the section.
        The same section/column settings apply for each column in this
        section.
    -   Column color scheme: Set to \"none\" by default. Choose from
        transparent (no outline), gray, blue, green, red, or yellow.
    -   Section title: Add a title to the section break.
    -   Collapsible: Check this box to allow the section to expand and
        collapse. A section title must first be provided before this
        option can be selected.
    -   Start closed: Check this box to force the collapsible section to
        be closed whenever the page is first loaded.
4.  Click the **Save** button to save your changes or the **Cancel**
    button to cancel.

## Remove a section break {#remove_a_section_break}

To remove a section break:

1.  Navigate to the location of the section break you wish to remove.
2.  Click on **Reorder** at the top of the page.
3.  Locate the section break you\'re wanting to remove.
4.  If the section is empty, or if you\'re wanting to delete the section
    and all items within the section, you can click on the trash can
    icon next to the section you wish to delete. If the section contains
    any items that you would like to preserve, you can click on the two
    arrows facing each other. This will automatically send items the
    section above so they\'re not deleted when the section is deleted.
5.  When you\'ve made the desired changes, click on **Save**.

## Remove a column break {#remove_a_column_break}

Note: There is no undo for this option, so use this cautiously.

To remove a column break:

1.  Navigate to the location of the column break you wish to remove.
2.  Click on the \"Join the adjacent two regions into one\" icon (two
    arrows facing each other) in the upper left-hand corner of the
    column.
3.  The contents of both columns should now appear in a single column.

\"Student Content\" permits students to add pages of their own. Those
pages look much like regular Lessons pages, although there are fewer
options. This allows students to share material with the rest of the
class. There is an option to permit other students to comment on their
work.

## Add Student Content {#add_student_content}

To add student content:

1.  Navigate to your Lessons tool.
2.  Click on **Add Content** and select **Add Student Content** under
    the \"Advanced Content Items\" heading.
3.  Instructors and students can create their own content pages
    immediately by clicking on **Add Your Own Page**.

## Edit Student Content {#edit_student_content}

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Edit** (pencil and paper icon) to the right of the text box.
    -   The Edit button will allow you to change certain details about
        the comment tool. This includes the following:
    -   **Make These Student Pages Anonymous** - The author of the page
        will not be shown, except to the instructor.
    -   **Add a Comments Section to Each Page** - Places a comments tool
        at the bottom of each page, allowing other students to comment
        on the work.
    -   **Make These Comments Anonymous** - The author of the comments
        will not be shown, except to the instructor.
    -   **Don\'t Release Item Until All Prerequisites are Completed** -
        Select this option if you would like the student contents
        section to be accessible only after previously \'Required\'
        items have been completed/accessed.
    -   **Require This Item** - Select this option to make this item a
        \'Required\' item for later on in the Lessons plan. The
        requirement will be satified once someone has added added a page
        with at least some content.
    -   **Edit the groups for which this item should be shown** - If you
        have groups or sections in the site, allows you to make the
        student content block visible only to some groups. Students who
        are not in one of the checked sections of groups will not see
        this item on their page at all.
3.  When you are satisfied with your changes, click **Save** at the
    bottom of the page. You can also click **Cancel** to return to your
    page without applying any changes.

## Remove Student Content {#remove_student_content}

To remove student content:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Click **Delete this item** (trash can icon) to the right of the
    student content.
3.  Click **Delete** to confirm deletion.

## Grade Student Content {#grade_student_content}

To grade student content:

1.  Navigate to the Lessons page you want to modify.
2.  Locate the student content section of the page.
3.  Click on a student\'s name.
4.  Enter their grade in the points text box and click on **Submit**.

2.  Click on **Add**.
3.  Enter the poll question and any additional instructions, such as the
    number of answers that the voter may select.
4.  Choose an opening date and a closing date, between which
    participants will be able to cast their votes.
5.  Next, select the maximum and minimum number of answer options that a
    user may select. If you want users to only select one option from
    the possible answers given, set both numbers to 1. If users may
    select more than one option, adjust these settings accordingly.
6.  Decide how and when results will be visible:
    -   Always - allows participants to see the results from the open
        date, even if they haven't voted.
    -   Never - restricts participants from seeing the results.
    -   To participants who have voted, or after closing date - allows
        participants to see the results from the open date, but only
        after they have voted, or everyone after the closing date.
    -   After closing date - restricts access to the results until the
        closing date, after which all participants (regardless of
        whether they have voted or not) will be able to view them.
    -   Never - students will never be able to see the results.
7.  Click on **Save and add options**.
8.  Type in the first answer option available for the question and then
    click on Save and add options. Repeat until all answer options have
    been entered, then click on **Save**.
9.  Click on **Save** to save the poll.

-   Add a new pool manually.
-   Create using markup text - Add a question pool by formatting
    questions and copying and pasting them into Isidore.
-   Import pool - Import a pool using a file.

\_\_TOC\_\_

## Adding a New Pool Manually {#adding_a_new_pool_manually}

Please see a video demonstration of this process:

\<youtube\>Vp8xVNlwIwM\</youtube\>

To create a question pool manually:

1.  Navigate to the **Tests & Quizzes** tool in your Isidore course
    site.
2.  Click on **Question Pools**.
3.  Click on **Add New Pool**.
4.  Enter a pool name. It\'s most helpful to include your class in the
    pool name so you can easily identify them (for example, BIO 101 -
    Animal Kingdom) and click on **Save**.
5.  If you don\'t see the name of the new pool you created, click on the
    **Assessments** tab and then click on the **Question Pools** tab.
6.  Click on the name of the new pool you\'re creating.
7.  Click on **Add Question**.
8.  Select a question type and click on **Save**.
9.  Depending on which question type you selected, you\'ll need to enter
    information like point value, question text, incorrect/correct
    answer choices, and feedback. When you\'re done editing the
    question, click on **Save**.
10. Continue adding questions until you\'ve built the question pool.
11. Once you\'ve added questions to the pool and reviewed your work, the
    question pool is [ ready to be used within an
    assessment](Create_a_Random_Draw_from_Question_Pools "wikilink").

## Adding an Assessment Using Markup Text {#adding_an_assessment_using_markup_text}

*Before following the steps below, format your text file by following
the [Format Questions for Markup
Text](Format_Questions_for_Markup_Text "wikilink") instructions.*

To create a question pool using markup text:

1.  Navigate to the **Tests & Quizzes** tool in your Isidore course
    site.
2.  Click on **Add**.
3.  Enter an assessment title.
4.  Select the \"Create using markup text\" option.
5.  Click on **Create**.
6.  Outside of Isidore, open the formatted text file that contains the
    questions, point values, correct answers, and answer choice options.
    -   Select all of the text by highlighting it.
    -   Copy all of the text.
7.  In Isidore, click into the text box and paste the text you copied
    into it.
8.  Click on **Next**.
9.  Review your questions, answers, and point value to ensure no
    corrections need made. If corrections are needed, click on the
    **Back** button near the bottom of the page. If everything looks
    good, click on the **Create Question Pool** button.
10. If you don\'t see the name of the new pool you created, click on the
    **Assessments** tab and then click on the **Question Pools** tab.
11. The question pool is [ ready to be used within an
    assessment](Create_a_Random_Draw_from_Question_Pools "wikilink").

## Importing an Assessment from a File {#importing_an_assessment_from_a_file}

*Before following the steps below, please review the [Export an
Assessment](Export_an_Assessment "wikilink") page.*

To import a pool from a file:

1.  Navigate to the **Tests & Quizzes** tool in your Isidore course
    site.
2.  Click on **Question Pools**.
3.  Click on **Import Pool**.
4.  Click on **Choose File** or **Browse\...**.
5.  Navigate to where the exported-assessment file is saved on your
    computer, select it, and click on **Open**.
6.  Click on **Import**.
7.  If you don\'t see the name of the new pool you created, click on the
    **Assessments** tab and then click on the **Question Pools** tab.
8.  The question pool is [ ready to be used within an
    assessment](Create_a_Random_Draw_from_Question_Pools "wikilink").

## Adding a Thread {#adding_a_thread}

To add a thread:

1.  Navigate to the Threaded Discussion tool in Lessons in your Isidore
    site.
2.  Click on **+Add Thread**.
3.  Enter a title for your message.
4.  Enter a Description (or body) of your message.
5.  Click on **+Thread**.

## Editing a Thread {#editing_a_thread}

To edit a thread:

1.  Navigate to the Threaded Discussion tool in Lessons in your Isidore
    site.
2.  Locate the thread you wish to edit and click on the **pencil**
    (edit) icon next to it.
3.  Make the desired changes.
4.  Click on **Update**.

## Deleting a Thread {#deleting_a_thread}

To delete a thread:

1.  Navigate to the Threaded Discussion tool in Lessons in your Isidore
    site.
2.  Locate the thread you wish to delete and click on the **trash can**
    (delete) icon next to it.
3.  Click on **Delete** to verify deletion.

`     ``<text bytes="5508" sha1="k3iamxbsn7mhthidmg6oi3lrpfrx7i5" xml:space="preserve">`{=html}`=Add a Zoom Meeting in Isidore=`

Meetings can be scheduled or created on-the-fly inside of Isidore.
Anyone in the **instructor** role can create meetings in the course
site. Teaching assistants and students do not have the ability to create
meetings in the course site.

Within the Zoom integration in Isidore, instructors have two tabs:
**Show Course Meetings** and **Show My Meetings**.

\"Show Course Meetings\" will let you see meetings created by ANY
instructor who has access to the course site.

\"Show My Meetings\" will let you see ONLY the meetings that you have
created yourself in the course site.

### Setting up a Course Meeting in Isidore {#setting_up_a_course_meeting_in_isidore}

1.  Navigate to the Isidore site where you\'d like to set up a meeting.
2.  Click on the **Schedule a New Meeting** button.
3.  Below are the settings that you should review.
    -   Topic: Adjust the default topic title if desired.
    -   When: Set a time the meeting room should open to participants
        (required). Please note that your meeting room will be active as
        soon as the host (you) join it, no matter when it has been
        scheduled.
    -   Duration: Set a duration for the meeting (required). You may set
        a recurring schedule if desired. Please note that the meeting
        room will remain active as long as the host is present in the
        room, even if the duration has expired.
4.  Below are the settings that you may optionally review and change,
    but the default settings should be sufficient.
    -   Description: Add a description.
    -   Registration: Forces participants to register with their email
        and name. [See
        more](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings)
    -   Audio: Change the audio options for participants.
    -   Meeting options:
        -   Require meeting password: This means that people will not be
            able to join the room unless they have the password. This
            could be useful in situations where you are trying to have a
            private meeting with a specific student and do not want
            anyone else to join.
        -   Enabled Join Before Host: This option is disabled at UD.
        -   Mute participants upon entry: This will mute participants
            mics when they join the room. They will have the option to
            unmute themselves at any time.
        -   User Personal Meeting ID: Use this if you would like to use
            your personal meeting ID.
        -   [Enable waiting
            room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room):
            This feature allows the host to control when participants
            join the meeting. As the meeting host, you can admit
            attendees one by one or hold all attendees in the waiting
            room and admit them all at once. Participants will see a
            message letting them know that the meeting host will let
            them into the room soon.
        -   [Record the meeting
            automatically](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202921119-Automatic-Recording):
            This option allows the host to start recording automatically
            when the meeting starts.
    -   Alternative hosts: Allows you to add an [alternative
        host](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/208220166-Alternative-Host).
        **Note:** Adding an \"alternative host\" does **not** allow a
        host to schedule concurrent meetings. You may only host one
        meeting at a time.
5.  Press **Save**.
6.  You will see an overview of the meeting room you have set up.
7.  Click on the **My Meetings** link at the top to return to the main
    page.
8.  When you and your students navigate to the Zoom tool in Isidore,
    they will see a tab called \"Upcoming Meetings\" with your meeting
    listed.

### Setting up a Personal Meeting in Isidore {#setting_up_a_personal_meeting_in_isidore}

You have the ability to your use personal meeting room to meet with
specific people. Your personal meeting room is an automatically assigned
permanent virtual room. You can start it at anytime or schedule it for a
future use. Your students CANNOT see the \"Personal Meeting Room\" tab
in Isidore like you can. Thus, if you start a meeting in your personal
meeting room, you will need to send the address of the meeting room to
any participants you would like to join you.

To arrange a meeting in your personal meeting room:

1.  Navigate to an Isidore site where you have Zoom installed.
2.  Click on the **Personal Meeting Room** tab.
3.  
4.  Choose one of the options below to start the meeting:
    -   Copy the **Join URL**. Paste and send via email to anyone you
        would like to invite to the room.
    -   For a more detailed invitation, press the **Copy the
        invitation** link, then press the **Copy Meeting Invitation**
        button. Paste and send via email to anyone you would like to
        invite to the room.
    -   In the **Time** section, click the **Google Calendar** button.
        Press \"Yes\" or \"Allow\" to let Zoom access your Google
        Calendar. Adjust the calendar date and time, add email addresses
        of anyone you would like to invite, then press **Save.**
    -   Press the **Start this Meeting** button at the bottom of the
        page.

# Add a Zoom Meeting outside of Isidore {#add_a_zoom_meeting_outside_of_isidore}

Anyone at UD may host Zoom meetings outside of Isidore.

### Setting up a Zoom Meeting outside of Isidore {#setting_up_a_zoom_meeting_outside_of_isidore}

1.  Open a browser and navigate to go.udayton.edu/zoom
2.  Click on the **Host** button.
3.  Sign in with your University of Dayton credentials.
4.  If this is the first time opening Zoom, follow the steps for
    [installing the Zoom client](Install_Zoom_Client "wikilink").
5.  If you see a pop-up asking to \"Open Zoom Meetings\", check the box
    for \"Always open these types of links in the associated app\", then
    click the **Open Zoom Meetings** button.
6.  The Zoom room will launch. It will launch your personal meeting
    room.

-   Create using assessment builder - Add an assessment from scratch,
    building questions within Isidore.
-   Create using markup text - Add an assessment by formatting questions
    and copying and pasting them into Isidore.
